content:
Posted: April 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have only a little time with the game, regardless of what my hours played says, because I left it running while I was working on mods. Overall, I can't really recommend it. The one time I  actually tried to play the campaign, it crashed on me within 10 minutes.Pros:Creating a model and getting it into the game is super easy if you're familiar with Unity. I spent almost all my free time this weekend modeling and then testing it in the game. I'm going to enjoy making models for this game.Game is looking better. It still needs some work, but I feel there's a good balance between graphics and performance. Cons:Crashed within 10 minutes of actually attempting to play the campaign. I'm not interested in sandbox mode except to test my models; I want the management sim part of the game as much as the rest.Modding side of the game is sorely missing some features, like the ability to give names to the individual models in a pack, set their prices, and give them descriptions.Seriously lacking in decoratives. Sure, we can fill that section out, but they should provide a fair number of them, too. Could never download anyone else's UGC. It always hung up on me.04/21 Edit: UGC is still messed up after latest (04/20) patch. 								While the new RollerCoaster Tycoon World early access, it is quite clear there are some major flaws. But, the tragedy this game has brought me through is simply no exception for the franchise, RollerCoaster Tycoon World better get it's s*** together before release. Aside from that, I am here to shed some light on why the game is so bad right now and why you shouldn't waste your money on this game if it continues in this downhill spiral. Pros:Rollercoaster building is new and innovativeThe game allows more freedom for the playerDive Coasters are a great addition to the listStations and chain lifts are betterCons (brace yourselves):Lack of coasters and rides you can buildTONS of major bugs involving building placement and tracksThe game may be too free for those who like to keep things straightYou can't pick up people anymore :(Game has some s*** graphics for some major lagCoaster camera is somewhat stiffCoaster train editing is blandCoaster entertainment means you can't build scary s*** or no one will ride it cause they're p******(Seriously, one drop and a loop will put your coaster to a 1 in excitement)HEIGHT LIMITS!!! (Hyper coasters can't even go past 300)The price of the damn game for this s***No chain lift catwalk beneath for inverted coastersOnly one side of chainlift for most regular coasterReally? no undoing a mistake (RIP Ctrl + Z)UI makes me want to commit SeppekuParks are dirty as s*** even with loads of janitorsNO WATER RIDESEA would prob do a better job at making this gameCareer mode is a jokeI prob missed some stuff but you get the point.INB4 9/10 -IGNBut seriously, keep your wallets safe out there kids.

								Do not buy this game for $50. It is a complete joke that they would even charge such a ridiculous price for such a game in its current state. I will say that this game is a lot of fun. The roller coaster creation is actuially pretty good (when it doesn't bug out). The main problem that i have with the game is that its VERY poorly optimized. It runs terribly. I could get a lot of enjoyment out of the game if it wasn't for the horrid performance. And i don't even mean like 15-20 FPS bad, I'm talking like a mediumish sized park with like 1900 people in it I get around 1-7 FPS. It is completely unplayable. I payed less than half of the steam price for this, and even then I still feel ripped off. If this game ever gets some optimization changes it would probably be a pretty enjoyable game, even with the lack of content in its current state.

number of helpful: 8 of 14 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								The game has potential to be something great... buuut with how it's looking so far, and from what i hear about the plans for it in the future, i can't possibly see myself enjoying this game very much. Why? i'll explain...First off, the small little rides you can set up here and there (ferris wheels, gravitron, merry go round, etc) are all nice and work flawlessly... But the moment I try building a  coaster, it just starts eating up SO MUCH MEMORY. Yes, this game uses up so much memory and processing, it's insane. It's definitely NOT optimized what so ever. I'm on a high end computer that can run just about every single game i have on here on max settings with flawless performance... but for some reason, this particular game, whenever I try building a coaster, or even spawn a premade one, it freezes up, crashes, and gives me a warning/error saying that too much memory is being used. Then java stops working, aaaand it dies all together. I learned this the hard way when I was spending a lot of time setting up paths, small rides, concessions, etc... and when i finally said "Alright, i think it's time to build a coaster!" Not even half way done with it, and it froze up and crashed and gave me that error. At first I though it was just an instance, so i booted it up again and gave it another go. Same thing. Any time I tried making a coaster,  it just died. So there goes all that time on an unsaved game. Oh yeah, that's another thing. The game doesn't have an autosave feature and I feel that if it's going to crash like this often, it probably should have one. To sum it all up...It looks cool and all, but holy hell, it just sucks up so much memory, your computer can't handle it and ends up halting it's processing on it all together automatically. So if you don't have a good computer, a REALLY GOOD COMPUTER, with LOTS of memory, then this game isn't for you. It's a shame... I was so excited about this game too. I love the RCT games and have been waiting for this one for years, only to see that it's in no way, shape, or form, ready to be played at all. And judging by what's being discussed by the devs, it's not going to be enjoyable in the years to come. =/

number of helpful: 19 of 36 people (53%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								I own Planet Coaster, Parkitect, and this.  Of the three, this is the more "complete" game, but that's using the word "complete" very loose.   Planet Coaster is a beautiful and easy to learn game. It is like using a lego set to construct whatever your imagination can allow you to,  but it is very early in Alpha and just consists of a sandbox mode. It's fun for what it is, but it's far from complete and has zero business management at this time. That said, I expect Planet Coaster to be the best of the three when everything is said and done.  Parkitect is also very early in release and, like Planet Coaster, is just a Sandbox mode. It's a nice indie title that is wonderful considering only a few people are developing it.  It also has promise but is too early in development to really make a strong decision either way.   Like Planet Coaster, absolutely zero business management in it at this time. This game...there's lots to be frustrated with, but also alot to have fun with as well.  I think this game has a place with both Planet Coaster and Parkitect, but it needs a ton of TLC and polish to really compete with Planet Coaster down the road.   I like some aspects about this game, but only because I was looking for something to scratch the business management itch of a theme park.   This is the only one out right now that touches on that aspect.  And I use the word "touches" loosely as well. I do recommend this only if your expectations are that you will be getting a game that is in early access. There is plenty that works with this game, but plenty that is broken.   If you can accept this than it's worth consideration.  Truthfully i think this game is worth more like $19.99 at this stage, but if you don't mind paying what they are asking and have a metric ton of patience, then this might be up your alley.

number of helpful: 19 of 36 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
												Im not sure why steam allows people to review the game in beta.  Upon downloading this game I did have some difficulties getting it to start (This should be fixed by the release) and there are some lag issues.  I believe the lag issues are because of the preset graphics settings for the game during beta.  People are getting all upset about little problem like these that may easily be fixed by an options menu.  It took me about an hour or two to get used to the controls, and before that this game was frustrating and unappealing to me.  After I mastered the controls of this beta the game became much more enjoyable and appealing.  Having played all three of the previous games this one deffinetely seems like it could be a step up in the future.  Many people are rating this entire game off of the first betas seeminly confusing rollercoaster builder.  I gaurentee you a good portion of the negative reviews are people who just cant move there mouse correctly.  After playing this game for 4 hours and recording 3 videos, here is my pros and cons chart.Pros: -Great vertex system of building the tracks.-New path system is great despite the fact that being symetric is nearly impossible.-Graphics are a huge step up from rollercoaster tycoon 3-Interface-New rollercoaster testing results guiCons: -No options in the first beta (really... this would have fixed a lot of people's problems)-No tutorial-No way to change or learn controls-Overly shaky when riding some rollercoaster (tends to make my head hurt)-Peeps sometimes just stop going on your rides (understandable con since the peeps are not finished yet)-Coaster Building was the main aspect of this beta, so all of the coaster settings should be available.Overall, this game is great to play and despite very little being available this beta I have yet to run out of things to do.

content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												It breaks my heart to see a game that was loved by so many for years come to this. I anticapated this release. I supported this release. I posted suggestions for improvements early in the alpha in hopes that this would be a game that redefined a genre. It appears that Atari put earplugs and blinders on and said, how can we make this un playable for a serious tycoonophyl. Some of the early requests I remember were simple ones. In fact, the one I remeber seeing most was just auto tunnel the stupid coasters, which is still not an option, and no matter how hard you try, you can't bring the ground up and over any track or path. I am utterly dissapointed in the end result and don't see any hope for improvement. If I could get a refund I would, but alas, I preordered and alpha'd. It's a horrible game in its current form. They shattered my hopes of an awesome addition to the series so profoundly that it may have cured me of preordering anything (I did alpha Planet Coaster and it turned out awesome). So cudos to Atari for ruining, for me, what was my favorite sim series of all time. They are the people who killed Kenny. (you know what goes here)............. Don't waste your cash. Buy Planet Coaster......

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 16, 2016
												You know, being a long time RollerCoaster Tycoon fan, this one hurt me. I started playing RCT when it first came out 17 years ago. I have been anxiously waiting for a follow up to 3 for a long time. After the first rocky reveal trailer for RCTW, the writing should have been on the wall. But they gave the reigns to a new developer and swore it would be better.Coming off of some 40 odd hours of Planet Coaster, this game looks, and plays like a joke.The style and the impression of the game that I got from playing makes it FEEL like an updated version of Bullfrog's Theme Park. The style is bland, the animations are hilariously bad, the tutorial is heavy handed.. It's just terrible. Coaster design is convoluted and messy, rides aren't fun to ride.The biggest joke is on me, for buying into the hype and the hope and purchasing the game through their website over a year ago, thus being ineligible for a refund through Steam or otherwise.Don't preorder games, and don't buy this one. Planet Coaster is the game you are looking for.

Early Access Review
								This feels like a completely different kind of game to me, and it's not worthy of being part of the Roller Coaster Tycoon Series. Relative Lack of Rides to choose from, Extreme lack of any music to add to your rides, All the music is boring, You cannot decide where to place ride entrances and exits, Roller Coaster Stations are fixed to a certain size and look, and the rides default names have been given stupid names instead of their actual names, for example: The Gravitron is now called Gravity Flux, and the Motion Simulator is now "Space Wars".Nvizzio Creations claimed to bring the fans something fun and something every Roller Coaster Tycoon fan would love, They Have FAILED, I am not impressed with this 4th Installment at all.Roller Coaster Tycoon World is very alienating to anyone who's much more familiar with the first 3 PC installments because it feels like a completely different kind of theme park simulator than what i expected out of the Roller Coaster Tycoon series. I am serious when i say this: Stick with the first 3 Installments, Roller Coaster Tycoon World became very boring very fast and very alienating to me as a fan of the Roller Coaster Tycoon Series. It is not worthy of being part of the Roller Coaster Tycoon Series.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												I wanted to like this game, really I did. I've been a fan of the RCT series since the 1st one, and I spent god knows HOW many hours playing RCT3. Rollercoaster Tycoon World was showing some promise when they release the first beta. It had lots of problems, but the devs were SO open to the community's feedback and input. However, I think this project just got too large for them--either that or this game became the perfect example of what happens when you try to please everyone. What's left is a game with far less options for creativity than any previous RCT game. Their coaster creator is promising but suffers from some awkward UI issues. And despite having some nice visual elements (I do like many of the coaster aesthetics), there are many laughable or groan-inducing design elements as well (let's pretend those park guests were never made). While Nvizzio no doubt did their best, this project got the best of them and fell flat on its face. If you're a fan of the previous RCT games, this one will definitely disappoint you and send you back to the old entries in the series or, more likely, head to that "other" roller coaster/theme park sim that just came out.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 30, 2016
												So now that I've seen the game in its full release, I must confess it's hardly any different from the beta. It's still quite crap.The good things I can comment on are the graphics. Graphics are very nice. When you test a rollercoaster it shows where on the track the speed, excitement, and everything changes and I have a feeling most of the work of this game went into the rollercoaster physics. This is where the good ends and the trouble begins.I'll start off lightly, the animations are still a little derpy on the guests. The mascots can look a bit creepy. But then let's get into more detail. There is almost no customization unless you use the steam workshop, but even then, there's just very little you can do with the rides, stalls, and staff. UI for the whole thing is a bit complicated and a steep learning curve. Things are a bit difficult to place as well and building paths is really crummy. You can't even have compact queue paths or curved queue paths. Guests seem a bit difficult to please as well. The waterphysics are bad, too. It's like a goop rather than water. The edges of the water aren't flat, they're round as if you've placed a very thick slime. Even the lake in the default forest map is overflowing and rounded out.There's just very little to do with the game and it feels very lacking. A few years of development and we get what feels more like a demo rather than a full release. Don't bother with this, go buy planet coaster if you want a good 3D park game.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								I honestly hoped this game would be any good, but sadly I cannot for the life of me recommend this game to anyone or their dog.I have had the opportunity to play the game when it was in Beta in November 2015, since I pre-ordered, and honestly, it seems like they have not done anything to improve the game. Surely they made the coasterbuilder a bit better, but rollercoaster tycoon is not ONLY about building coasters. It is about managing your park, and you are are not able to manage it properly.- The game offers a variety of screens that allow you to look at how, and where, you are and aren't making money, but you do not have the control like in previous RCT games.- The game tells you when a ride has been waiting for a long time on a mechanic to fix it when it is broken, but there is no way to find a mechanic. the only thing you can do is build an extra stall and pray that that resolves it somehow. A management game should be about managing your employees, whom seem to be INVISIBLE. How can you manage that?I could go on about this all day, how bad the game performs, lacking BASIC features, misalignment in the User Interface and completely unnecessary differences in ride menus for every single ride, very ugly looking character models, very ugly looking rides, etc. etc.Basically, just don't buy this game, buy one of it's competitors. They are much better.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								10/31/2015: (Closed "Beta",  DON'T LIE,♥♥♥♥♥♥IS A PRE-ALPHA)So, originally I had a really bad taste in my mouth after 9 hrs of gameplay and putting up with difficult coaster editor and items not locking to the grid.  This led me to give a negative review.  The thing I didnt realize was that if i looked past the bugs in the editor, like the twisting of the track, the support columns being placed in irritating places causing the coaster to run into them, or items not lining up with the grid, the editor was, in fact, the most powerful piece of software I have seen in a coaster game (RCT 1/2/3, No Limits 2, etc. etc.)  I took the time today to really attempt to figure out how the software was to work for me instead of fighting it.  After 2 hrs today, I have finally figured it out and have build a coaster that was IMO, free drawn.  After testing the coaster, you see where sh*t crashes and a few of the bugs causing this (pillars) but this is the point.   It is a process of perfecting your design.  Build, test, tweak, build, test, tweak.  The ability to allow such freehand movement has "in a way" made me feel as though i was using a design software such as AutoCAD.  Yes, this beta is bare bones and there are hardly any features unlocked, but they are breaking the game down into the bare-bones in order to ask the communitry what we like or do not like.  Imagine if they released a beta with all the bells and whistles.  You would not notice very minute problems in the 3 days they test for.  Yes, the editor takes time.  You almost have to train yourself (which in a video game, is not what I look for, for fun) but it does present a challenge, and challenges I like.  So, after refunded the game last night after being a little disappointed, I have decided to give it another go.  I'm glad I did.  These are not gamebreaking issues and I have absolute faith that these folks developing the game are striving to create one of the best.For those people who like to place "premade" coasters (which I also love to do when I'm not in the mood to build), there will be a slew of them according to the devs along with Steam Workshop support and mods.  Besides that, I believe there will be tons of content in free DLC and updates as the devs have promised.  There will also be the "old" track editor in the game like we are all used to in the old RCTs if you want to place tracks that way.  The point is, you don't HAVE to use the coaster editor but I want them to keep it, just fix it. Although, I judged the game on the beta, I have learned not to do this as it is not indicative of the final product.   But do not take my review as saying "buy this game" because I'm not saying that.  I am saying "WAIT" to buy this game or if you are easily frustrated, wait until the second beta.My hardware:Intel Core i7 2.5Ghz, 16 GB RAM, Nvidia Geforce 980M 4 GB VRAM, Windows 10Things that need fixing:Coaster editor bugs: Problems in auto pillar placement glitching thru the trackRandom twisting in the track while attempting to edit a mid track segmentMouse pointer/game desyncingWhen clicking on a node mid track, the track should not move until you apply whatever adjustments you are making (right now when clicking, the node will jump randomly of the screen and mess up what u have created"Live grid doesnt line up with piece you are trying to place sometimes.Not bugs but add this: No "undo" button, add edge of screen scrolling or right clicking on map to drag cameraDecorations:Items snap into areas you dont want them to go, once again, using freehand placement and grid (this is one of the issues that doesn't allow me to feel as though I have control over what I'm doing (which is premise of this whole game).  Example was, placed a path laid out according to the grid.  Attempted to place light posts, bushes, and benches.  They would line up on one side of the path, but on the other side, the bench or the posts would be off increasing my OCD.  I turned off the grid to attempt it freehand.  Same thing. So this needs fixingThe ability to "change path color" without deleting the path.  This is annoying.  It also defaults to the ugly red color even after you have been using the other paths so you place the path and realize, you have to delete and choose the right one and do it again.EDIT: Also add an "upgrade function" to either change the color of the path or upgrade size from small to large and vice-versa.Terrain Tools:Terrain works well.Althought the zoom feature to increase/decrease brush size is nice and natural, add a brush size setting as to allow people to have that "option".  Keywords in all of this is "options".  The more options to build, the better, and the more people will buy the game.Hope this has cleared things up.  Once again, the game IS based on the coaster editor but it will not be the ONLY building tool for coasters, but it will be there if you wanna use it, which i recommend (after being tweaked and fixed) in order to give you total freedom to build how you want.TL:DR:This is a "beta" more like an "alpha" but the game is stripped of the bells and whistles to address a select few items as to focus beta tester's attention to just those items in order to collect as much data and feedback to be able to fix the issues and give us as players what we want.My advice to potential buyers is to buy this game, LATER.  Just don't buy it NOW.  WAIT until the next beta  to see how the devs have progressed on addressing the above issues.  I have total faith these folks will fix the issues and bring us a great game but may require pushing back the release of the game if needed so this doesn't end up like SimCity.  I will give them a chance and after next beta, if the issues still remain, I will get a refund.UPDATE 03/30/2016: I have since upgraded my PC since writing the above review.  Specs are below:i5-6600K16GB RAMGTX 980TI Hybrid 6GBWindows 10 Pro 64 BitI get 144FPS with frame rate drops to 10 fps.  Crashes, bugs, etc.  The loading screen looks like a gay pride parade with rainbow colors flickering across the screen.  Then when the peeps enter the park they are jumping around like a bunch of idiots all frolicking and♥♥♥♥♥♥  It took me 2 hours to build a coaster and then the game crashed, losing all my progress.  FFSThere has been ZERO progress IMO as far as fixing what I stated above.  Honestly, I don't want to waste anymore time on reviewing this game.  Not really a game but more a job.  I feel like I should be getting paid to play this.  It's not even fun.I must've been smoking some good♥♥♥♥♥♥when I wrote the above review.  WTF have you people done for the last few months while pushing this back?  None of the above issues were fixed.  The grid is still garbage, the coaster builder is still trash.  Even after adding the manual track builder, that♥♥♥♥♥♥doesn't even work right.  I add a premade track piece and its all twisted up like a noodle.  It's like Ray Charles decided he was going to make a game, while driving, while giving other people directions on how to drive.  Give it up.  SHUT IT DOWN!!!! Everyone that buys this and cannot get a refund needs to open up a class action lawsuit.  Why?  Because it takes you 2 hrs to even get the coaster builder to work correctly.  I could build a five star condo in the time it takes for me to build 3 track pieces and most people will spend 2 hours doing that and cannot get a refund.  DO NOT BUY THIS GARBAGE, I REPEAT DO NOT BUY THIS GARBAGE!!  GET PLANET COASTER. TL:DR:  DON'T F**KING DO IT. DO NOT BUY THIS.  SHUT IT DOWN ATARI, SHUT IT DOWN NVIZZIO.  Good thing I only paid 18 bucks for this.

content:
Posted: July 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								Despite the many tweaks and bugs that need to be fixed, this is a good game.I instantly was thrown back to the old RCT 1 and 2 days. This is nowhere near as good as though, but this game is well on the way to be that great.The grid system needs to be overhauled. The center of the grid should line up with the entrance of the park. This way one person could create a perfect symmetrical park with the entrance. It always looks off center the way it is not. The grid should perfectly be centered to the park entrance and the edges of the map boundaries. The water and land modifier needs to be overhauled. Water is awful. They need to return to the old system from RCT 1 or 2. The water should just fill a pool instead of acting like a hose. Same with modifying land heights. It should be a click and hold feature. And the brush sizes should be larger and snap to the grid perfectly. Mine were all of square because the grid off square. These are a couple issues I have with the game that others haven't really mentioned. Most people just complain about bugs and optimization so I stayed away from that. The game has probably 30 rides you can use and a lot of food and souvenir booths. Peeps are still buggy, but I think it is still fun to play. Excited to see how this game shapes up in a year. Early Access Score: 6/10 Hopefully when this game releases I can give RTC World a better score.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								The good of a man is often buried with them, but the evil lives on afterwards...I've been an RCT fan since the very beginning, it was for a time my childhood, before the internet my brother and I would sit side by side on our computers (of which my mobile is now more powerful) and play Roller Coaster Tycoon. So forgive me in assuming having bought every Roller Coaster Tycoon game and their expansions over the years, for feeling a little disappointed and hard done by.Prior to buying and downloading, I watched youtube videos and whilst I liked the idea of planet coaster and the other rivals, I stood and was loyal to RCT and went and brought a copy.Yes, its early access and yes there is a hugh amount of work to be done, but it is not the same and never will be. Its full of amazing concepts and big ideas and on paper if I had $10,000,0000 I would support it or take the ideas and rebuild it myself. but I dont, but they do and they appear to have made a shambles of it.I log into steam every day to see if there is an update and I read the blogs with interest, hoping and praying that with each next release its fixed, but its becoming an embarassement to the RCT name. There is so much it could do and so much potential, so much that excites me about it... so much I want it to be... But it just isnt. I'm hoping that (if the developers dont see sense and fly me out to their offices immediately to help fix their mess) that within 6 months this game is fixed and actually playable. I've tried hard to have an open mind and to make this game playable but it just isnt. My advice if you are feeling thrifty this month is to take the money you would have spent on it and give it all to the next homeless person you see, or if you are not that way inclined, buy yourself and the homeless person a pizza with it, because quite frankly, the way it is right now, you'd both be miles better off in life than you would be if you owned this game.I'm not saying, don't buy it, you may think its great (if you've been living in a cave since 1999) but if you are expecting a game that is better than I could download for free on my phone, then currently you are looking in the wrong place.My conclusion you ask?  Is to wait a little and see what happens. I'll keep trying it and if it lives up to my expectations eventually I will recommend you buy it. For now? Stick your credit card back in your wallet, its not even worth the interest let alone the pennies...Thank god for steam, buying it on a DVD would be an insult to the plastic its burnt into!

They truly have created the spiritual successor to RCT3. Do yourself a favor and check it out, it's what RCTW should have been.

content:

Early Access Review
								The path building mechanics are annoying compared to previous RCT games; rotating and raising is a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ and overseeing employees seems to be an impossible task (my three mechanics wouldn't fix any rides, and I had a park full of broken rides and peeps floating around... whaaa!?)Despite the above, and the frustrations encountered thus far, I'm still giving this a thumbs up. There's a lot of potential for this game, and I do hope it keeps getting updated and improved. I haven't encountered any massive glitches thus far, though given the floating peeps and drop in FPS, I'm sure it's not far off. Again, despite this, heaps of potential for this game if they continue with improvements and at present, it's fairly enjoyable if you're a patient person.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												Unfortunately, this game is nowhere near finished. The graphics are good, the coaster cam is good and it's fun to build a park.BUT: on the managment side, everything is missing!For example: you can't get a sortable overview of all rides you have and see how popular they are, what their profits are etc. And in the overviews that ARE available, you can't click on the name of a ride to go to it.The data displayed in the profits-tab is completely useless to me: for example, a burger stall has an hourly profit of $2000, has been open for 2 years and has made a total profit of $2500 so far.And if you want to create a themed part of your park, for example Sci-fi, you have to go through all options (lights, benches, etc) since there are no filters. You can filter neither on type nor on theme. We already had these options in Rollercoaster Tycoon 3, but it's all missing now.All in all it's just not really a get at all, but more of a 3D modelling program. If that's what you're looking for, then this is for you. But if you also want a management game and make some sense of why you are or are not making any money, then you should not buy this game at all.

								This was a game I really loved as a kid & was one of my first loves, together with Zoo Tycoon & Age of Mythology. So you can guess my level of excitement when I spotted this game was in development, anticipating I would live up to the legacy left behind by its predecessors.Unfortunately after not even 5h in-game I decided to call it.It is nowhere near the level it should be, it’s very clunky, squeezes every inch out of my ultra-high end gaming PC and graphics are, by today’s standards, mediocre at best.However, there is potential in it and I will be sure to follow this up with another review in due time when the final version is released and much needed patches & bug fixes are applied.As the game is today, I would NOT recommend it but I would recommend to wait and see IF this becomes a game worth playing in 6 months or so.

content:
Posted: April 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								After playing this game some more and mysteriously having my key revoked without a refund, I have decided that this game is the biggest heap of♥♥♥♥♥♥to ever enter Steam since Rome 2 Total War.Growing up on RCT2 and RCT3 (yes, I am that young), which were both incredible games, my expectations for this game were extremely high.It was fraught with problems. At first I forgave them, because it was in Early Access.Let's start with the positives (of which there are few), though. We have to give this game a chance, right?Good things:-Snazzy new coaster builder-Snazzy new paths builder-I REALLY like the new restaurants which replace basic food stands-Cars in coaster trains can be different colours-The new water tool isn't efficient at all but it's top banterThat's it.Anyway, back to the negatives (of which there are many):Not only did I learn that this game was not made by the original developers, but I also noticed more and more things that are catastrophically wrong with this game. For a start, it's massively overpriced.Then you get into the rollercoaster ratings. I simply cannot get anywhere in the campaigns because rollercoasters are rated as high intensity WAYYYY too easily, and in order to make a 'coaster that is exciting at all, it needs to have pretty much ultra-extreme intensity... so nobody rides it and you just lost 20,000 monies, pal.You only have a small amount of music choices, and they are just variations of exactly the same tune in a depressingly low quality, which drives you bloody insane in five minutes.Sometimes when you place custom tracks using the snazzy new spline coaster builder, you cannot add another section because the new secton has to be a pre-built track. This is probably hard to understand, and we face a dilemma because in order to properly understand you need to play the game, but that is something you absolutely do not want to do.I thought I could deal with the supports problem but it is SO common that it is UNFORGIVEABLE. It is so infuriating to have a nice creation utterly ruined and the immersion completely shattered by a track support going through the middle of your loop.But BY FAR THE WORST PROBLEM is the optimisation. Having spent £960 on a computer, which I have to say is a very good one, you'd expect to get good performance on this game. Right?NOOOO!On the very lowest settings on a flat map with a couple of rollercoasters, my computer struggles to reach 20fps. On a map with varied terrain and many rollercoasters, I might as well be watching a slideshow.I will now proceed to wait impatiently for Planet Coaster, after learning that it was actually made by the developers of RCT3 and it's not just a cheap knockoff of the RCT series. You want to know what a cheap knockoff of the RCT series is?This game.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is terrible... like really terrible. It looks NOTHING like the screenshots that were constantly being shared by the developers. The game's graphics are horrible even on the highest settings. Also, the frame rates drop a lot as well. I have a Geforce GTX 960 graphics card with an Intel i7 processor. This is the ONLY game I've played that has horrible graphics on my PC. I'm really disappointed. The anti-aliasing doesn't even work well. It's not even just the graphics either. The overall gameplay is terrible. Building rides is too complex. It's hard to build a decent roller coaster without coming across too many problems. The controls are too difficult. Also, you can't even change the color schemes of most rides.This is the first Roller Coaster Tycoon game that I've been upset about. The other three were fine the way they are. Even though RCT3 has its faults, it's still better than this game. Save your money! Do NOT buy this game until it becomes better (if that happens).I've been a life long fan of the Roller Coaster Tycoon franchise since I was a child! I've been playing since the game was released (1999). This one game has left me horribly disappointed. They ruined this once great franchise! :(

content:
Posted: July 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								So this game is getting my reccommendation because its quite obviously a work in progress. The developers seem genuinely interested in what the community has to say, and for that they get my recommendation.The issues I've noted with the game so far are for the most part already described, but for the uninformed, I'll go into them briefly.-Pathing and structure layout needs work-Peep and employee control needs work-Game starts to lag after large amounts of items are placed-The coaster design panel could use some smoothing over, I just have some issues with the way the controls are layed outAnd those are the most major issues seen in most reviews. Now for the fun part, what I truly like!-The game is absolutely gorgeous graphically, it was high time for an updated RCT and this game captures that spirit wonderfully. You can tell that although its a work in progress this is truly going to be a wonderfule heir to the series.-The theming, while in true RCT style can get slightly excessive, allows for a wonderful array of customibality (probably spelled that wrong, ah well). Everything from the music to the cues can be colored and placed, and they've added things like fake walls and beautiful plazas and centerpieces that allow you to create whole sections of thematically designed park. You can get lost for hours just placing correct pieces *just so*. I'd love to see more themed items soon.-The notification panel is handy. With smart phone like features it allows you to view park info and see both the good and bad fairly quickly. Not exactly a new thing, but definitely well updated, although it needs some work.-And overall the HUD layout seems fairly streamlined and definitely more modernized. It could use a bit of tweaking here and there, but its fairly easy to use which I suppose is a priority.Anyways, so that's a few of my opinions. Hopes this helps both the new and the old Tycoons in their buying/desicion making.

Im trying to enjoy this piece of crap the best i can, but when i can't even build a roller coaster with loops then this game should not even be on the market. 2. The path system in this game is terrible! You can't connect the paths straight have the time, again how am I supposed to make a functioning theme park if i cant have good looking paths! 3. The game can't even hit 60FPS. I have a really good computer but i cant even hit 60FPS with this game.4. The camera controlls are terrible. What the heack is up with having q and e to rotate the camera. Why not just use the mouse. 4. The Roller coaster features are terrible. number of helpful: 9 of 17 people (53%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								I'm confused by all the negative reviews. I just bought the game and spent a few hours building a park and rollercoasters etc.. I'm enjoying the game. The camera is smooth and the placement is fairly good. I love the coaster builder in this. It's leaps and bounds above RCT3. I have no trouble linking my track to the station like I did in RCT3 sometimes.IT's not perfect it took me a few minutes to figure out the menu and camera controls. There's a lot missing but I think it will be in the final release. The fences are really bad and I hope theyll rethink those to be able to snap to the pathways or allow users to shape them like pathways. Speaking of pathways I'm not sure why you can't make cue lines curved but I would like to see that. other notable things that's missing are the transport rides which is the thing I like the most in RCT3. There needs to be more default rides and scenery but whats in the game is pretty solid so far. As far as the frame drop goes I did have a pretty big frame drop but the honest truth is I never noticed it until I looked at the fame counter. Right now I would recommend this over planet coaster if you can only afford one. The only reason I say that is because you can actually play this game now. The Steam vrsion of planet coaster hints to being able to play early if you buy the deluxe package but thats not so. I have watched videos on youtube about both of these games and RollerCoaster Tycoon World doesn't look as fleshed out as Planet Coaster but after playing it despite the negative reviews I'm quite happy with this game.

content:

Early Access Review
								WOW! I mean, I do not understand what people are complaining about. EARLY ACCESS means just that it is in BETA really. Everything is not going to work as expected. But what dumb***es do not realize is they have a chance to help direct the way this game is developed before being FINAL Release. Look, I have been with RCT since 1996, YEAH 20 YEARS I have been waiting for an RCT which interacts this way. This game is enjoyable to play if meet the system requirements. And from what I have read at the developers web site, MOST people FAIL to meet the requirments for this game, yet they complain about performance of the game. The game is there and it has HUGE potential and it will get if you are patient enough to wait out the bumpy ride. It is getting smoother with every update. Blog #11, Update #8 at the time of this writing, and this game is very enjoyable as long as you meet the requirments. To be honest, my gaming PC doesn't have an i5, but I have a 3.2GHz Pentium and it gets rough sometimes, but that will soon clear up as soon as I get the i7 I am looking in to here before summer is over. Then my computer will really fly and game will be even more enjoyable as it is meant to be!

content:
Posted: August 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								I'm confused by all the negative reviews. I just bought the game and spent a few hours building a park and rollercoasters etc.. I'm enjoying the game. The camera is smooth and the placement is fairly good. I love the coaster builder in this. It's leaps and bounds above RCT3. I have no trouble linking my track to the station like I did in RCT3 sometimes.IT's not perfect it took me a few minutes to figure out the menu and camera controls. There's a lot missing but I think it will be in the final release. The fences are really bad and I hope theyll rethink those to be able to snap to the pathways or allow users to shape them like pathways. Speaking of pathways I'm not sure why you can't make cue lines curved but I would like to see that. other notable things that's missing are the transport rides which is the thing I like the most in RCT3. There needs to be more default rides and scenery but whats in the game is pretty solid so far. As far as the frame drop goes I did have a pretty big frame drop but the honest truth is I never noticed it until I looked at the fame counter. Right now I would recommend this over planet coaster if you can only afford one. The only reason I say that is because you can actually play this game now. The Steam vrsion of planet coaster hints to being able to play early if you buy the deluxe package but thats not so. I have watched videos on youtube about both of these games and RollerCoaster Tycoon World doesn't look as fleshed out as Planet Coaster but after playing it despite the negative reviews I'm quite happy with this game.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
												As of right now I can't recommend this game. I know it is only a beta, but with less than 6 weeks to go until the initial release, it is clear to see that this game is going to need a lot of polishing, so much polishing in fact, that I think that the devs are not going to be able to put a well working game together, by the time this game does launch. This is a real shame, because I had really high hopes for this game and have been waiting on it for quite some time.I had hoped everything would have worked the way I wanted it to work, but unfortunately it diddn't.The coaster editor and builder are very complicated, it even takes a highly experienced RCT player and modder like me, a hell of a lot of time to get used to (let alone build a good working coaster), the cars constantly bump into an invisible wall at the end of the station, making them fall off, or hit some kind of bump on the lift hill and fall through the track. Also when the cars fall through (and sometimes into) the track, it is impossible to despawn them, making it impossible to go further with your coaster and you might as well delete it as you can't do anything about it. The snap to grid function is basically non-existent, the grid does not allign properly and this makes it nearly impossible to build straight tracks and paths.I personally don't think they should have called this a Beta, it can't even be called an Alpha at this stage (in my eyes)There is still so much work that has to go into this game, that I personally think that the devs and designers should push back the release to give everything a good look over and some polishing. I still think there is potential in this game though, I hope Atari and NVizzio will iron out all mistakes and listen to what their customers have to say and want, otherwise I think I will back away from this game and get the Opponent's game.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								Oh my god. Wow. What an absolute atrocity of a game.Parks are only big enough to contain one rollercoaster, which are a NIGHTMARE to try and build (They put in a new little piece-by-piece coaster editor since the beta for when the other editor gets on your nerves too much but honestly that may be the only thing about this game that doesn't make me want to rip my hair out, and even IT was put in as an alternative to a feature which evidently even the programmers realized was hugely flawed).I play a game called Nolimits Coaster, which is a realistic simulator that real world coaster companies use to simulate how their rollercoasters are going to end up looking, and even it is easier to build a rollercoaster in than this game, and the coasters here don't come CLOSE to realistic (and even when I tried to aim for realism, it still said my rides are too intense for some reason, if they didn't just flat out fly off the track)Even putting aside rollercoaster building as a whole due to how terrible they are (despite them arguably being the entire POINT of the Rollercoaster Tycoon series) the game is awful. The flat rides look "whimsical" and pre-themed, which might not bother people who aren't big on theming their own park or having a park that looks realistic, but for coaster nerds like me it's a huge turn-off.The tutorial sort of cut out halfway through, and basically, I stopped playing after an hour and a half so I can immediatly demand my money back and preorder Planet Coaster (A game made by the people who made RCT3, who's ALPHA is currently looking way better than this thing).I get that MAYBE a part of them was trying to set things straight and give fans the game they wanted, but they ran out of time before they got the chance, but... Man, this is a really bad game. Really bad. They didn't listen to the fans enough, they kept stuff secret for too long, and tried to fix it when they didn't have enough time to. The result is a buggy, hard to play game with missing features.It left me feeling angry and wondering where I put my Rollercoaster Tycoon 3 CD.I would honestly not be surprised to see that the studio ends up closing after a huge flop such as this. This is a dud the size of which I've seen lead to game or movie studios going bankrupt in the past.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2016
												So what is there to say about RCTW, right now the game is in early access and I cannot at this moment recommend the game, there are to many bugs, to many things that plain dont work and seems to be too much reliance on UGC. The problem is and its the biggest problem this game has to face it is widely hated there are more people playing RCT3 than this, this means less people making ugc and less people there to entice Atari/Nvizzio to continue supporting the game.If I really had to put a value on the game I'd say $10 - $15 so if you can pick it up in a sale for that amount I recommend you do. As I have said this is in early access with the promise of it being finished incl. Peice by peice builder, water rides, transport rides, etc..I will continue to update this review as long as Atari keep updating the game and if they achieve all their promises this will surely be a game I recommend. Just not yet.Update 11 Nov 16:So has the game got any better? its been 6 months you'd hope so right, well it has got marginally better but its still a terrible game, the community has gone. Piece by Piece has finally come out and it isn't all that bad but compared to competitors its way off the mark.I must say I change my previous not recommended review to seriously not recommended, even if you can find it for $15-$20 don't bother save your money. This game is talking about leaving early access and it is soooo far from being anywhere near being finished. Most people cannot even play the game it's so broken.Do not buy right now, it is broken, wait for a few more months and see what happens (it'll also be cheaper ;))Update for Final Release:So the game has finally been released, is it worth it quite simply no. Nvizzio has worked very hard, theres a new story mode, it can be quite boring at times and the missions dont have much creativity. There are still a lot of bugs, the AI is still the worst thing about the game as in it does not work at all.The peeps and ride animations have been improved but still needs work to be done to make them what I would call good. There are promised of more content and patches post release so like I have said since the beginning, it is not worth it yet wait until more content and fixes. I will update when said fixes arrive.Do not recommend

content:
Posted: April 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								Everyone in my park disappeared and then I got 500 people rushing through the entrance. Now i'm rich.Serious review:This game doesn't deserve all of the hate it recieves. It's not a bad game, it's enjoyable but not perfect.Pros:- Better rollercoaster creator than RCT3- Menus are simple and easy to navigate- EnjoyableCons:- Poorly optimised- Graphics are quite bad. This may be a pro eventually as in the latest update they improved the graphics.- Limited customization options.- Crashes often - If you buy this, save your park every 5-10 minutes so you don't lose your progress.- The price is too high for an early access game.- Bugs. Bugs everywhere. So far i've come across at least 15 bugs. Some are amazing, some are terrible. Here's a few bugs i've come across so far.. Mechanics ignore my broken rides.. Everyone in the park disappearing and then re-entering the park.. Can't disable "heat maps".. People get stuck in the floor. This happened to my mechanic, a few of my janitors and even some of the "peeps".Yes, Planet Coaster IS better than this game. Yes, it will likely always be better than this game. BUT, this is still a great game despite the bugs and the terrible optimisation. It may not have a lot of the features Planet Coaster has but that doesn't make it unenjoyable. In my opinion, this is an alright game for people that want a Rollercoaster themed game right now but can't afford £50 to play Planet Coaster early. But then again, Rollercoaster tycoon 3 is a cheaper option for a rollercoaster themed game and honestly, it has more features and better graphics than this.EDIT: it seems that people who hate the game are downvoting almost every positive review.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								Updated for EA release.Game is all good but there are a few issues that should be sorted by the time it is fully complete don't be fooled by the crazy amount of negative feedback its getting, some are genuine and some are abit longed out getting an unfinished product after waiting so long but a huge amount is just people comparing and bashing it because of PC.Pros --Coaster builder is really cool and much more stable compared to the beta. It does take some getting used to but once you've mastered 1-4 the creations you come out with look epic.-Tycoon elements are kind of there setting the price for rides and entry is key to staying on top and not going into debt.-Map looks great and they are really fun to build on. The devs have already said a flat map mode will be added but I'm pretty happy with the 3 already here.-Decor also really cool will be good once there is alot more but whats here looks sweet and it can really make your park look cool.-Other rides the time and attention put in is noticable they look really good especially compared to RCT3.-UI, I get loads of people don't like it but I've not had any issues other than one thing but I'll put it in the cons it was by no means a deal breaker though. -Build a massive coaster and pay after is a really good move can really help push time along just building some beast and not having to pay for the completed ride until you wish to open it. Was always long running out of money back in RCT2,3.Cons--Alot is missing, some might feel ripped off paying so much for what you get and how unstable it can be at times.-Glitchy I've had peeps all spawn by the entrance after loading. I've had my money drop at 10,000 a second after the heat tab bugged out, not sure if this is a bug but cant seem to build anything beyond zero depth if I put a coaster drop at -1 depth it will always crash.-Unstable only at times I would build a few coasters and Ill start to get major slow down it goes back to normal speed after a while but it does remind you your playing a early access game.-Some plants vanish from view if you go more than 1 foot away from them it might sound silly to some but after spending a few hours making some sick flower display it can really grind your gears that its all invisible when zoomed the slightest bit out!-UI only issues I have is with the heat panel it makes me go minus in money other than this one thing its all good.-Peeps getting bored of rides it sounds like a really good idea to put this in but it just ends up making sure you will always fail. After 9 years in game time no one other than the odd one or two peeps would ride anything in the first 3 zones of my map they desperately need to add a scenario maker and add the option to restrict what % peeps will get bored at so they never fully find any ride boring.-Lack of management for any in park services. This is something they said they will be working on but it is something that needs to be sorted asap not one of my 100+ mechanics would fix the circus and there is no way to find them or set them to do a task or even give them a radius in which to patrol. I'm not feeling just put down a building and hope they are working, it does not work. -No colour change tab for any of the pre build family, junior and thrill rides they look good but dont see why this isnt just a normal feature.-Long load times its not a deal breaker for me but in this day and age any long loading screen is a con.Things that need to be added please - -Smaller rollercoaster entrances. -More decor, rides and shops.-Being able to build rides through mountains and at minus depth and maybe tunnels in water?-Camera to take peeps pictures on rides was surprised this wasn't in the build panel.-Scenario maker just like the one RCT3 had would be sweet.-Staff tab and general commands just like the previous game would work fine.-Balloons that float off and the ability to pop the kids ones to ruin there day.-Water rides, gokart rides, zoo stuff and water world stuff im sure it'll all come but want to be able to build an epic gokart track again soon.-More music and themes.-Option added to sandbox mode to set starting money if the scenario maker takes too long to come.- Map grid mode improvements. Just put the grid over the whole map and let it change size as it does now just over the whole map. Its not bad how it is but it can be off putting at times all moving about.Overall It's a really fun game as is but I will look forward to all the updates, it might have awful reviews but dont be put off by them. It will freeze on occasion and it is a little glitchy but so are loads of EA games. People need to be more patient and stop bashing it and filling the forums up with comparison discussions. I'm sure PC is a great early alpha too but the only thing RCTW have done diffrent is put it on steam in EA instead of releasing through there site. I've already had a load of fun with what's here and I can see myself playing this for days on end. 7/10 - based off of EA quality and features-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------(Original beta review)The beta is a frustrating experience for anyone who loves the originals. Its completely different to what where use to and building a coaster can seem like more of a crazy hard mission than fun I was going in thinking it would be RCT3 with better graphics, controller support and the tools to finally be able to build diagonal with my paths and all over the place with my rails but its not!You can do all this but it feels odd and hard and nothing like RCT3 but this is why its going to be so great. I only played for a tiny amount of time but now I see how fresh this is and what it could possibly be on launch. I never remembered playing RCT2 and smashing it first park and when I got around to smashing RCT3 I thought the 3D jump was unneeded and looked messy but after a few hours you get sucked in and all becomes well and good and after plating this dodgy beta Im sure it'll have that same effect. I have faith in Atari and the other teams behind this, I may not of been as buzzed playing the beta as I thought I was going to be but Im now more hyped for that finished product. Looking forward to learning how everything works and building my own park with all these changes to an already great franchise.Pros in beta - - Everything was different to what I assumed it was going to be like.- Looks pretty. - Coaster freeform although hard was fun.- Decor looked crisp - That Atari provided a beta.Changes if not already in the pipeline -- Day and night cycle far to fast please get the balance RCT3 had. - Camera seemed over wonky in the coaster builder mode half the time my mouse was off screen and I couldn't see clearly where to place my coaster because I had to be zoomed so far out. (Im sure this is just a beta issue)- Map size seemed small because the coasters have to be so huge to work, hope this was just a beta map size and not all where getting.- Controller support seemed useless I gave up after 10mins just remove it.- More coaster stats, would be cool to see speed and g-force while placing rail.- better UI and sort something out about holding SHIFT and scrolling to change rail tilt and height, It felt annoying and would just change the camera height half the time. Just let it be a 1 click process like click the height rail button now scroll to change height then click to place and click the change height button again to go back to just normal rail placement. (Maybe my keyboard was giving me the run about on this one but either way the 1 click process should be a thing)Overall will look forward to playing the next beta but more importantly I cant wait to be playing the full game and losing days to the graft of building the mega coaster.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
												Although RollerCoaster Tycoon is one of my favorite game franchies, this latest incarnation has me worried. I'm unimpressed with the pre-order Beta weekend. The game seems far from finished (although due to be released in a little over a month),The game ran very slowly on my machine (8gb ram), though I was one of the fortunate ones that didn't have continuous crashing problems. The beta was limited to a very small portion of the game content and limited to two weekends of play between now and release. Overall the user interface felt laggy and clunky. The coaster builder was interesting but riddled with bugs and physics issues. Building a complete coaster that wasn't simply a lift, drop and circle back to the station was almost constantly met with incredible frustration. (And I'm not new to the genre, I still play RCT3 and building coasters is my favorite aspect of the game)I am quite surprised by this beta release. I expected a nearly completed game, a smooth and lag free engine and an exciting preview of what awaited the final release. Instead it was an unfnished  mess of problems that felt like a very limited alpha test. I have requested a refund and will wait to see what the reviews are like after the game releases in December before deciding to purchase or not.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
												I recommend passing over this game and instead buying Frontier's Planet Coaster. It's not the game we deserved, but the one we needed. So we'll buy it. Because Frontier can take our sales. Because they're not our hero. Frontier is a silent guardian, a watchful protector. A true sequel.This game does not live up to the RCT name. It would take at least twice as much development as it currently has to get anywhere close. If you're crazy about theme park simulation games, you might find some enjoyment from it, but let me go over the good and the bad.PROS:Not limited to a tile system like the previous titlesCoaster builder has piece by piece functionality, although limitedCONS:No piece by piece structure building like in previous titlesNo water rides, transport rides etcCoaster builder is extremely challenging to work with  --> It uses your camera's orientation and mouse position to orient new nodes  --> Clicking on a node moves it  --> Often tells you that smoother curves are impossible and forces bad track design  --> View of nodes is obstructed when adjustments are deemed illegal, making it hard to fix  --> No smoothing or straightening track functionality  --> Coasters don't slow down due to friction as much as you would expect  --> Coaster supports are unrealistic and don't reappear if removed  --> Brakes don't work properly, causing coasters to fail  --> Block brakes don't work properly, and multiple trains often cause coasters to stop working  --> Height limit is unrealistically low (80m)Coaster types  --> Missing kiddie coaster, wild mouse, corkscrew coaster, looping coaster  --> Spinning coaster spins irradically, causing high intensity ratings no matter how realistic  --> Launch coaster catapult is too short and launches to height limit (80m) at slowest settingPeeps are not properly implemented  --> An unrealistic number of peeps visit your park (300+ with just a carousel)  --> Zooming out causes peeps to turn into a slideshow  --> Zooming in fully does a weird blur thing (fake DOF?) causing peeps to disappear  --> Peeps puke, pee, and litter an unrealistic amount, making parks look like garbagePaths are difficult to work with and not properly implemented  --> Snaps to nodes at the center of pathways rather than the outside edges  --> Ride queues cannot be curved  --> No stairs  --> Cannot place stalls/rides right next to the path, must create a short path connecting each  --> Elevated pathways often clip through the ground  --> Elevated pathways cannot contain path objects like benches  --> Connecting to other path nodes can be extremely laggyTheming is more limited than previous titles  --> Restricted to generic, western, sci-fi, adventureStaff is poorly implemented  --> No staff zoning  --> Staff ignores buildings, fences, etc, preferring to phase through them like ghostsDeleting is poorly implemented  --> No auto delete for scenery when building coasters/paths  --> Delete tool is extremely laggy when mousing over objectsFilling in parks with rides causes FPS tanking (I went from 60 to 14 after building 4 coasters)tl;dr there are more cons than pros

content:
Posted: March 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								So this is the Early Access version of the game and not the completed version, I've played the previous games in the franchise which I spent most of my childhood playing and decided to try out the latest edition. I didnt expect it to be perfect as its still being developed but after around 10 hours of playing the game I pretty much enjoyed it! The game basically takes me back to the original released in 1999 which was simple and focued on the rides and managment, this was the first I played and it was very entertaining. The customisation is also a work in progress as more themes have been confirmed by the developers as well as other stuff. The CoasterBuilder is also new and brilliant! It allows the franchise to evolve with players pulling and dragging the tracks making it more flexible. The second game in the series basically had lots of customisation and built on the first title however the newest game lacks themes and other objects but with more from the developers it soon might improve, the game also has user generated support so lots might be provided from the community of tycoon fans. The third game in the series bacially went 3d and wanted to expand everywhere which in my opinion didnt work and pushed many gamers back to the 2 originals, the UI and campaign were so bad I continued playing RCT2 as it seems the developers went crazy with zoos and water parks however with the newest game going back to its roots and starting again its seems the franchise can get back to its best! Many of the newest games features are very promising and deserve some time to be made perfect, Im willing to wait and share my experience with the developers to make the game decent and a standard which the originals set! You've probably noticied that this review section is full of negetivie reviews, many just complain about the littlest bugs or problems that are not major and are expected as the game is in development! Im not suggesting they are not allowed a opinion but i thinks its alarming and unfair  that many of these players have only played the game for a short amount of time, I consider this not to be enough gametime time to judge a game such as RollerCoasterTycoon. Myself was actually confused getting to know the controls for the first hour however as I progressed it became more enjoyable, easy and relatable to the previous games in the series. The reason I'm writing this is because I would not want any possible players considering trying the game to be put off by a few comments that mostly include minimun issues, Its also  because most of these include the word "PlanetCoaster" Which is a similar game but shouldnt be advertised by their fanbase on this review section. Many will claim its a better game but thats your opinion however most of these people have not played RCTW long enought to make a review as many have played for a matter of minutes as I have seen. It also seems many have just followed the trail of popular youtubers, not fully given the game a chance and can not spot a valid problem with thr game that matters deeply in their reviews. These sort of reviews are not reviews so I reconmend you read wisely and check out some videos online to make your opinion.Overall the game is playable and enjoyable in Early Access, It has so much potentical that will hopefully be developed with the fans, its been truely resurrected from the ashes and seems to be going back to its roots similar to the original base game. E.T might have killed Atari along time ago but its certain now that Atari is back and evolving with RollerCoaster Tycoon World!

content:
Posted: October 30, 2015
												Okay, This is NOT finished. Yes, i'm rating it up, but it is VERY close to being rated down. I payed 60$ for the beta (OVER A YEAR AGO) and, well, they have not made that much improvment. See there are the good sides to it, but there are major disadvantages. Here's the list:PROS:+Better graphics+It still IS a theme park simulation, which I enjoy.+Many other fixesNow for the list of CONS. Just because there are more does not mean that I do not like the game more than I do, these cons are mainly just minor. -Performance. Yeah. After they said you needed a "GTX 460" I was like "Sweet!" Yeah, that turned out to be kind of a bummer. See, with my GTX 1060 at high settings, I still was getting lag in my park, and in order to get rid of it I had to restart my game. I put it to low settings, and that did help. (Also, what you can do is minimize it's task in the task manager.) So I am asking to PLEASE fix that.-Peeps from far away. Um, hello? Peeps are getting VERY LOW fps from far distances. I don't know WHY, or how. Is this normal???-Terrain editor. Yeah, it works, or maybe it works... too well. WOW this thing is laggy. 72 FPS normally, dropped down to 12. Yeah.-Coaster editor. You really need a option to depump verticies (My spelling tho) like other roller coaster simulations. See, what this does is it smooths your track out so it is not bumpy, because that is one of my major problems. It looks VERY smooth from the outside, then I go to ride it, and my train is whipping me around.                                                                To Be Honest:       Yes, this game has potential, (I have not tried Planet Coaster) but I think that since more people like PC, it has more potential. Not trying to compare, but I really do think so. And, I hope they fix this game sooner or later, but for now, this game is easily a 6/10.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								Updated review -----------------------After spending another hour or so with the game I still struggle to recommend it to anyone especially @ full price. I worked out a lot of stuff that makes it a bit more playable, but still, there is a lot of "frustration" in this game in it's current state.  Will it ever be fixed? I don't know, still a negative review it needs a LOT of work.  Not being able to move ride entrances / exits is killer for designing a park the way I like, the paths are horrible, building a straight path to another is usually impossible unless you are lucky enough to be aligned to it's snap points. Coaster builder takes patience, but seems serviable (except having to use shift+mouse wheel to adjust height/tilt is clunky). The peeps look worse than RCT3, with unatural/freaky animations. The graphics sadly also look worse and shadows are so bad they should of left them out. Performace is "jerky" especially on-ride camera, which may or may not work. I did a Let's Play Video.


YouTube™ Video: Let's Play Rollercoaster Tycoon World 

			Views: 113		

			Hour long lets play video of me playing Rollercoaster Tycoon World. I play the first campaign in the game. It's about 30 mins in when I start to build a coaster (locked until then).		

Some of the stuff in my first review is not valid like it is possible to snap shops to path (press N). The game lack any love/care/soul which is heartbreaking to see how the mighty series has fallen.  First review below (after an hour of play)------------------------------------------------------------Absolute rubbish, avoid like the plague. Frame rate is horrrendousCoaster builder is clunkyImpossible to build straight paths (sure they are straight but not in relation to any other path in the game)Can't move ride enterance or ExitsPeople being sick, no idea where i'm suppose to employ staff to clean up.**On ride cam... broken.Shadows missing supports (on rollercoasters)Can't snap shops to paths. So build a shop, then have to build a path to it.Paths are horrible / broken.Peeps run like well weird, it just looks un-natural, like they have 2 animatation frames.Placing objects (scenery for instance) is guess work.Building coasters, is there a bush in your way? TOUGH you can't build it. You have to quit the builder, demolish the bush, go back to the coaster, click build. I will be amazed if this game turns into anything playable before Atari abandons it. There is a short list for you to begin with, I'll give it a full review later when I have more time.**I've discovered I have to buy a staff building of the staff type to get the staff I require. So like a mechanic hut for mechanics, or a Janitors hut for cleaners. However, once done, there is no fine control over them, I dont think I can even move them (staff members) manually. So if someone is sick, I just have to hope a member of the cleaner team is wandering past.

								This game needs a huge amount of work. I was slightly impressed by the manouverabiliy of the rollercoasters and paths, but thats where the good points end. Graphics are terrible, the guests look ridiculous.The camera is clumsy to move around, I found previous Rct games had cumbersum cameras but Rtc world has taken a huge step back.There is hardly any control over the staff, previous games allowed for training and patrol areas, this game doesnt.I could't get past the tutorial stage before giving up on it.The game appeared to be advertised as a full finished game, I had to read the news feed to discover it wasn't(After paying for it). I'm not sure if I will be entitled to the full game when its complete, but if this game doesn't see a major overhaul before release I will certainly be looking for a refund.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								Before you read too far into this here are my computer specs:I-7 Quad Core 4790 @3.60 GhZ processorRAM: 16 GBHDD - 1 TBNvidia GTX GEForce 970 graphics cardWindows 7 Home Premium Service Pack 1Now then:I can't say what everyone else is when it comes to "destroyed"... but after playing not even 20 minutes... i clicked on the grid option for placing paths, couldn't get them to lay down straight without it glitching out and refusing to connect to the primary park entrance region, which caused Peeps to wander aimlessly with no ability to go out into the park. The sounds of peeps (primarily on thrill rides) glitch out and desync almost immediately, causing sounds to continue BEFORE and AFTER the ride begins. When zooming out the peeps begin to moonwalk, and look as if their legs aren't even moving.Attempting to create a coaster lead to despair. The coaster creation option was slow to respond, crashing twice on me when attempting to place the final piece of track. The third time it gave me problems about opening the track due to a Shop being near the ticket entrance. This lead to me opening and closing the shop rather than the coaster (it wouldn't let me click the coaster), placing lights refused to be placed anywhere unless connected to the side of a STRAIGHT piece of path, which, with how the paths were letting me place them, was impossible since the straight paths were inaccessible nor useful in the park. Adding curved path was even harder, much of it refused to place, saying it was "too short" or "too sharp" of a turn no matter what i tried....I'm sorry Atari, but you guys really need to work on much of the core aspect of this game You tried, but the excitement of pushing a product out into the public out-weighed your needs to push a few more alpha tests, and a volley of Beta tests, before you opened it to early access.... It's 7 p.m here. And since the refund is only valid until early tomorrow morning i am sad to say but i must take up on that offer. I will look into repurchasing this game when the game is properly taken into consideration, and the game's future is seriously calculated into your next patch-up job to fix these game breaking errors. Goodluck, Atari.In its current state* i cannot support/recommend this game. Please go play Tycoon 3 until they can properly amend the damages. Otherwise give Planet Coaster a try, it's made by the guys who helped make the original 3 RCT's, AND they made Elite: Dangerous.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								So far, this game is a disappointment. Obviously, that may change with time and future updates (as will my review).So far, the controls for the game are overly cumbersome, their new roller coaster designer is a nightmare to try and use, and other than (somewhat) updated graphics, the game offers very little in the way of new content.The number of rides offered in the game is pitiful compared to previous games. The shops/buildings are poorly sized and just get in the way. The terrain editor is a nuisance, and to make things worse, you have to individually click each tree/bush/object to delete it and clear space to build. No more click and drag over an area to delete trees, landscaping, etc. The path builder is more aggravating than the one in RCT3.I am hoping the game improves with future updates. So far, it is nowhere near worth the $50 price tag, nor is the "Deluxe Edition" worth an extra $10, as it adds almost nothing of interest to the game. Until they make this game worth the buy and worthy of modern graphics and processing ability, save your money and go play RCT2 or 3.
