								This is going to be a fair review from someone how has loved every roller coaster tycoon game before it other than the mobile one. i came into this game ignoring the steam reviews because i didnt want that to affect my view on the game. now after playing for a fiew hours then now just reading the reviews the hate doesnt match what i have played. content:
Posted: December 31, 2016
												RCTW for my short time playing it has gamebreaking bugs (in the sense of crashes during games and even loading games).  Those bugs could well be ironed out over time if the Dev's are still on the case, it would obviously make sense for them to do so in the long run because if they don't have a stable core game they won't easily be able to bring out expansions etc.  (So I'm pretty sure they haven't abandoned it like some would believe.)My play on it also currently suggests that you need an optimal rig to play it (Hexacore/Octocore rigs).  So if you have a low or medium spec potatoe, you'll find any park you build between crashes becoming a flickerfest as it becomes CPU locked from thousands of parkgoers and ride animations.  It's possible that some of the problems can be resolved by toning down the graphics complexity to suit your rig, however there's always going to be diehards that think because they can run a completely different game engine on Ultra, everything else should be able to as well.  (Sorry it doesn't work like that)Other than that the game has great potential but you should consider that if you buy it, be prepared for bugs/crashes until the Dev's fix them.

number of helpful: 4 of 12 people (33%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 31, 2016
												RCTW for my short time playing it has gamebreaking bugs (in the sense of crashes during games and even loading games).  Those bugs could well be ironed out over time if the Dev's are still on the case, it would obviously make sense for them to do so in the long run because if they don't have a stable core game they won't easily be able to bring out expansions etc.  (So I'm pretty sure they haven't abandoned it like some would believe.)My play on it also currently suggests that you need an optimal rig to play it (Hexacore/Octocore rigs).  So if you have a low or medium spec potatoe, you'll find any park you build between crashes becoming a flickerfest as it becomes CPU locked from thousands of parkgoers and ride animations.  It's possible that some of the problems can be resolved by toning down the graphics complexity to suit your rig, however there's always going to be diehards that think because they can run a completely different game engine on Ultra, everything else should be able to as well.  (Sorry it doesn't work like that)Other than that the game has great potential but you should consider that if you buy it, be prepared for bugs/crashes until the Dev's fix them.

content:
Posted: October 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								I am extremely impressed with the current state of the game, going against public opinion. Although some features could stand to be polished, overall the game is coming together nicely. The coaster builder in the beta is not for everyone, but the limits to it are endless. You can now make some really cool inversions that would not be possible in the first three roller coaster tycoons. Many people are claiming that the beta is very "broken" but i'd like to say that with some few adjustments to controls, or even custom keybindings, most of the issuses can be fixed. Just because a beta has bugs doesnt make it broken. Also, the grid based building feature has only been TEMPORARILY disabled, not removed, some reviews are claiming that it has been and its "killing the game". If the current spline system is too complicated for you there will be an alternative. This  beta is meant to exhibit the spline coaster builder.Edit: You people really dont know what "Early access" means do you?

number of helpful: 3 of 10 people (30%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								Loved RCT franchise and was so excited when I heards RCTW was coming out.  I am tisht and don't normally pre-order games and usually wait until they are in a good sale, however I preordered this as soon as I heard it was being developed.  I will say that I also bought Planet Coster too and have been playing the alpha of that.  I have no bias and I actually want to have two great theme park games.  I will continue to edit this as the game develops.I've been playing theme park games for decades (yes, I am that old!!) and it's one of my favourite style of games.The pre-realease weekend they did last year was a disaster and I was worried what game I would actually get for my money.  I anxiously waited for the next pre-release weekend until I saw that it was now released on "Early Access".   I guess they felt pressured to actually release something now that Planet Coaster was starting to do releases.About the game.  The game does have a lot of features in it already to enable you  to actually build and manage a theme park.  This is definately in Early Access as there are issues that need to be addressed and features that need to be tweaked, but I have not experienced so many issues like other players.ProsLots of feature to enable you to buld and manage the park.A wide number of flat rides, coasters and shops to choose from.The user content feature is amazingIssues to be addressed (in my humble opinion)Improved coaster building since pre-Early Access, but still is very fiddly and cumbersome to actually build a rollercoaster.  I'm sure with a lot of practice it will become easier, but even using the RCT like buttons to lay the track, it still isn't as easy and straight forward as RCT3.Path building needs to be worked onNeeds the ability to demolish in a draggable area.  This maybe there, but I can't get it to work.  Its a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥to delete every tree and bush to be able to put a ride down.It's not so clear the benefit of the different size staff buildings.  Is there a coverage radius that they cover?I personally don't like being fored to have the entrances/exits fixed to the rides.Should you buy this game?  I would still say yes.  I know there are problems with it, some people have experienced lag which I haven't.  I have faith that Atari are listiening to the community and will be implementing the changes, requests and fixes as the game develops.  Since release they have already done a couple of updates and I hope that they continue the pace and release frequent updates and changes rather than waiting months.Yes, there are features in Planet Coaster that this game doesn't have and there's no arguing that the Planet Coaster videos look amazing.  Like I said earlier, I'd like to have two great rollercoaster games as I'm sure they'll both have their strengths and weaknesses.  Time will tell how both games will be developed.  For now, I will be spending far more time plating Roller Coaster Tycoon World than I will Planet Coaster.

number of helpful: 2 of 8 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Even though I only have ~20 hours on RCTW I think that thats all you really need to play the game fully and find every bug. This review is based on the Early ReleaseThe biggest problem im having is depth. I understand that it is an Early Release but it feels like im playing a Revamped RCT3. So far we have seen no water rides, no police guards, trees that dont delete automatically and the standard 4 themes with 3 parks. We waited for a decade and were given a broken system that had many bugs, puke and trash everwere. The mechanics would get stuck at the exit of a ride and wouldnt fix it. There can be three rides broken but if you dont have 20 mechanics to fix it then they wont know its broken. There is a lack of depth in the whole system. I like to be able to customize the workers in the park again and would like to see better use of the sanitation system. The new physics engin is Good right now but update #3 has hit it hard in a good way. (But this is not about update #3). The new roller coaster builder is the main perk of the game and offers a much more realistic aspect to the game. Though sometimes the supports will apprear in the middle of the track the train simply goes through them... Speaking of trains no transport rides. The ratio of the game is large enough for at least a transport train, how about the good old ski lift ride. Also will there be any pools or water park add ons or will I have to pay another $50 to get thoes, maybe $10. Overall the game has a LOT of potential. But for how much time it took to get it out and how much it cost it was kinda a let down. Im still going to play the game just because I love the game. But I and the rest of the RCT community were kinda let down. I have high hopes for the future though to see what NVizzio and ATARI give us in the updates and UGC's, which is a awesome addition. The game is power hungry. With and empty park i have full 60fps with a few blips here and there. But soon after you get a few rides and about 600 peeps i dropped to about 35fps. Basic Rig Specs CPU - i5-6600K CPU @ 3.50GHz (3.80GHz Boost)GPU - AMD R9 380 4gb MSI Gamer SeriesMemory - 8gb Corsair Vengeance DDR4 2400 (2x4)Motherboard - Gigabyte Z170XP-SLI-CFSSD - Main C: - Sandisk z400s 256gb SATA III HDD - Game Files Z: - 7200RPM WD500 Blue SATA IIIPSU - EVGA Supernova 750w GQ GoldWindows 10 ProRough est...1080p - no AA - High Detail - Low Shadow = 35fps avg------------------------------------------------------------------------------- April 26 2016 - ARG Publications™

number of helpful: 2 of 8 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								If you are a fan of the RollerCoaster Tycoon games then you need to buy this.  I have to be honest and say that there are definitely issues, BUT it is still good.  There are some issues with the graphics being a little rough around the edges and the staff need more options.  It is good to play another coaster game and the new coaster design is pretty good.It is early access and I wish it wasn't, but that means that I don't have to settle with what I have.  I can make recommendations and expect them to be applied to the game.***I am editing this to be more speific about the errors so they can be fixed!***- The Janitors need help.  I have 16 of them and they get confused and much of my park remains filthy.  There use to be an option to drag and drop them and also to designate a certain area for them to focus cleaning.  That needs to come back.  I believe thats an absolute necessity.- The benches are confusing.  When I first put them down only a couple of people used them ( I have many benches).  Not only that but the guests were walking through the benches.  So, I moved them to the grass.  No one walked through them anymore, but the benches aren't even being used now.- The mechanics are as bad as the janitors.  I have 13 of them and they wonder about without a clue as to what they need to do ( most of the time).  I will have a ride break down and stay that way for ingame days before someone fixes it.  That makes no sense, because I have more mechanics than I do rides and plenty of paths for them to easily access the broken ride.-  Some of the outlines on the guests are wonky.  You know, when you click on them and get close enough you can see the white outline?  Yeah, some of those are just not right.- I am not sure the info kiosk updates when new stuff is built.  I have people wondering around lost.  - Why are my people angry about the souvenir stalls? They say it will have to do...Is this because it doesn't target their age-group?  Is it the prices?  Is it the color or theme?  Speaking of color and theme; these should be changeable via the actual building or, at least, the color.  All my hats are blue!!!  That is not okay.- Placement of buildings frustrates me to no end.  Why can't I snap them to pathways?  Why must I pull them back from the path and make another path to them?  To me, that is not okay.- There definitely needs to be a better bulldozer tool for mass-destruction.- There also needs to be subways and such. Also water rides.  My guests want, nay, need a log flume.

number of helpful: 1 of 6 people (17%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game was released nice and early and naturally that is because they need the support from fans to improve it.  I would like to point out some issues as of today that I know people are curious about considering all the upset reviews.  I have always loved these titles. So, I noticed reading comments that alot of people are upset with how the staff you place in your park are not great. From playing I see what they mean, but! They do get it done, although it takes time... I never really saw negative effects to my parks score. Or gotten notifications that the park was to messy. I had alot of complaints about there not being enough room as in pathways and things of that nature still no real effect on my overall score but I am sure that is something that can be fixed by simply making the park larger. And I look forward to figuring that out.  I took a picture of my park to display my overall score and all the annoying notifications everyones speaking of but I dont think i can post that here, but it shows my score is great although pesky notifications are there regarding the park staff being to low and stuff. As far as Roller coaster designing goes I am absolutely impressed!!!! The amount of control we have now when creating coasters is amazing absolutely great job done there. I have come to notice that getting the coasters just right takes some trial and error.  So far each coaster I have made is leading to puking guests. But they still ride it somehow lol. They give you pre-built track peices but you by no means have to use them. You can design whatever you want by simply editing a node this allows you to twist and turn or add speed boosters or breaks to tracks and it is very easy to use. I have not figured out if you can go underground with them yet that was always a favorite of mine. And yes there are pre-built tracks if you prefer that.

Early Access Review
								There are a lot of negative reviews, and some of them I will somewhat agree on, the coaster designer is finnicky and certainly takes time to get the hang of, so far despite my computers issues with crashing like it has been lately, I am personally loving it, yes it indeed does have a good bit of work left but if you are a fanboy of the series like myself, I think you may love it, I myself do. Again, finnicky and tough to get the hang of, but it's a lot of fun! It's really a hit or miss in the long run, if you like Rollercoaster Tycoon, give it a whirl if you want, but if you don't, then don't bother with it honestly because there's nothing here for you unless you are a fan of the series as I am myself since day one. All in all, to my personal preference, I am loving it so far, and I think it may have a bright future with how the devs are handling there blogs lately, perhaps a good direction towards a wonderful position for the game. It's a blast! But most definitely buy at your own risk, not for everybody but if you love Rollercoaster Tycoon like myself, give it a go guys!EDIT: After banking a few more hours up, I maxed the settings and I will agree with some of the reviews, the graphics are just barely better than RCT3 in some situations, but the performance wasn't impaced all that much for me even with my ancient components, being an old Core2 Q9400, two 560's, and an nForce 790i FTW mobo, it did lag in some places but overall it did quite well, which kind of surprised be with the system requirements it lists. Overall however, if they updated the graphics, added more coasters and rides, and tweaked the optomiization for a little smoother flow it'll be perfect for me personally.   All in all, still I will say, buy at your own risk, if you love the series as I do, you'll love it!

content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
												NOTICE: this review is lengthy, if tldr, check pros/consIn short, there seems to be a lot to look forward too for RCTW, however there are many tweaks that need to be made. That said, from what I see from forums, this game will not be as popular as the original trilogy because the coaster designer is much more complex to use than in previous itterations. There are only 7 or 8 different coaster types currently present in RCTW and many classics from the second and even first games are missing. My guess is that additional coaster types will be offered via paid DLC, the thought leaves a bad taste in my mouth, but I can't think of another reason why certain 'cornerstone' rollercoasters such as corkscrew coasters aren't available already.The 'innovative' Spline based coaster designer is an interesting take on coaster design, it works well if you plan on building a coaster without any inversions. However, as soon as you plan on including corkscrews, loops or any other inversion. You will almost instantly get frustrated. I found it extremely difficult to create straight lines of coaster track, perhaps because the track is always attached to your cursor before you place it, and while trying to move around simultaneously, the track quickly becomes twisted and messed up. There is a premade loop that can be used, however it does not look realistic and is way too steep. The other premade track piece is a 'vertical corkscrew'. Were the developers smoking crack when they came up with that one?One of the only things that made me actually feel like I was playing a RollerCoaster Tycoon series game was when it came to choosing the colour design of the coaster. Perhaps this is because they did little to no innovation in this area, as none was needed.I designed a hypercoaster in RCTW that seemed fairly successful in design, but the test statistics showed that the ride was hardly 'fun' at all. I know for certain that this coaster would've had atleast 5 excitement if I had made it with any of the original games.It was impossible for me to judge the physics engine this game has because it was impossible to have the coaster running while maintaining a decent framerate. This, despite my computer exceeding the system requirements of the game. There is no Options menu and there is no way to change the resolution, change graphics settings or even any audio settings. I yearn for the ability to mute the annoying music that comes on if you scroll out far enough. As well, the sounds that I am assuming come from the rollercoaster stations are really obnoxious and need to be changed. However this may work itself out as more features and other sounds are added. Controlling the game is a bit of hit and miss, You move around the map with the arrow keys or WASD, I was unable to move around by dragging my cursor to the edge of the screen, something I think is critical for this kind of game. There are a large variety of paths in the game and the system seems to be fairly fleshed out and competent.All in all, if the developers manage a way to include a simplified coaster designer, in the vein of the coaster designer from the original games, I feel this game will see massive success. Aesthetically pleasing and once fully optimized, I will give this game another shot. Pros+decent graphics+complex coaster designer+painting coaster track+fleshed out path systemCons-annoying sound design-complex coaster designer-limited amount of coaster types-vertical corkscrew will haunt my dreams-no corkscrew/arrow dynamics coasters-coaster statistics function completely different-poor optimization-no options menu (albeit this is beta, would be nice to mute audio)-moving around is awkward

number of helpful: 13 of 31 people (42%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 30, 2015
												IF YOU WANT SOMETHING NEW, COOL, AND FUNCTIONAL, AND OWN RCT2, JUST DOWNLOAD OPENRCT2Do not bother with this game.  It is flopping heavily with its loyal forgiving fans, and PCGamer and Atari themselves hyping this game up before it even came out seemed suspicious enough for be, but I bought it anyways.  Even with my middle-high tier PC, I feel like I was loading it on XP, ARK performed better than this.I'm not going to complain about the coaster editor, I love the spline editor, and it was going really good.  What I will complain about is the crashing is way too sensitive.  Call it difficult if you want, but it's hard to get fast speeds and keep your coaster on the track when the hill collisions don't even work and it flies off the coaster before it even gets to the hill.Your cursor and the spline editor will also magically de-sync, making the game unplayable, and for the life of me, I cannot figure out how to delete parts without having to delete the whole coaster.The music is horrid and if it reminded me of anything, it reminded me of how bad the Sim City reboot was.  That's what this game is.The beta doesn't even work in windowed mode!  You can't even change the resolution!  It's horrible!  The options menu is literally just the terms of service!!  And considering this is the most resource heavy game I've ever played on my computer, video settings are what you absolutely need the most!Maybe it will become better in the future.  I was psyched for the custom content, but nobody's going to create custom content for a game this bad.  If you want to download CC, download OpenRCT2 and look up some custom content for that.  I'm applying for my refund right now.

Early Access Review
								Fun, enjoyable game!  I've played several hours on it already, and haven't encountered any serious issues.  Sure, it needs some polishing.  The graphics aren't the best, but usually things get optimized at the end of the development cycle, not the middle.For all those giving this negative reviews, try to think in terms of the enjoyment the game can give.  It delivers on what it promises, albeit not perfectly.  The developers made it clear that it's a work in progress, and we - the gaming community - should support them!For those who are talking about Planet Coaster - it is true that the graphics there are much better so far.  However, it's also still in early alpha, and as an individual who purchased it, I can attest to Planet Coaster lacking many of the features that RCTW has, despite having more optimization and modernization in it.The bottom line is - I believe this is a legitimate successor in the RCT franchise, and would recommend that people consider it!

content:
Posted: May 15, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								I've never played any RollerCoaster Tycoon or anything Tycoon before and I have to say it's quite addicting!! I'm a big Sims fan so no suprise I like this too. I love all the different themes you can go with in this game (different types of land, different types of rided and decorations) and I hope more will be added soon. I like how you can zoom way in and essentially explore your park through the "Peeps" view, it's helped me improve a lot of the customization before. That said, I think the Peeps graphics could be improved a bit more and animations smoothed out when you're zoomed out, but it definitely didn't take away from my experience.The controls are a little funky but I got used to them pretty quick. I would suggest to the developers to improve the controls--make rotating objects a lot faster, implement edge scrolling (when I move my mouse to the edge of the screen the camera moves that direction), and have more intuitive controls. I had some performance issues with Campaign mode, but not any other mode (sandbox works FANTASTIC), so I think there needs to be some bug and performance things fixed with Campaign mode but ever since I switched to sandbox I haven't had any problems at all so I've just stuck with that! I love that you can turn off unlimited money and have the ground either be flat or rugged and natural; I like my parks to look more realistic rather than just a flat ground, but sometimes I'll do the flat ground and make my own mountains and stuff so the "sandbox" mode really lives up to its name.For my first Tycoon game I definitely have had a lot of fun so far and look forward to more improvements and features.

number of helpful: 3 of 11 people (27%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								Unlike most, I'd like to focus on this game's POTENTIAL. It clearly has that, but there are too many problems at its core that should've been adressed before the BETA. It's the greatest paradox of modern gaming- it's beautiful but horribly lacks detail- has so much potential but is damned to fail. In case the dev's see this I'd like to point out some small things that would go a long way in fixing this game before I move onto the cons. BTW I have not played planet coaster, I'm judging RCTW on its OWN merit. The only thing that scares me is that the company will see the mostly negative reception and pull funding out of it completely- things CAN be fixed but may not be PROFITABLE to fix when the client base is already weeping and gnashing their teeth at their early access build. Pros-Diversity of scenery options, peeps, and rides.-It's Rollercoaster Tycoon.-Lack of detail aside, has a unique, beautiful flow.-Can still charge peeps to use restrooms-Coasters crash (BUT NEEDS EXPLOSIONS)-Peeps are funny although I think it's because they're bugged (the other bugs aren't as funny)*As early access, they still have to patch this game at least once before they release itHelpful fixes-Add HD free DLC, also add option to toggle peep detail/resolution (would help performance with 1000+ peeps)-Selection tool should automatically balance terrain- too many unbuildable open spots where things SHOULD fit.-There's already a sandbox mode- make the campaign harder i.e. stalls not making profit by default-We're not all Mac users- add advanced video options!!! Not all of us like depth of field.-Add more stuff don't rely on the community to make your game, we ADD to it. ;DCons (of the type that should've been fixed before beta- lets go easy on the dev's)-Peeps IGNORE trash cans and throw up past them in the exit paths. -Janitors don't actually start working until you click on building and they leave. And they suck at their job.-Beautiful aesthetic but major lack of detail. (HD DLC?)-Peep AI is horrible. Optimization is horrible but since it's early access there's still hope. (REDESIGN OVER)-Selection/snap/grid system (which is core) is bad. Too many open spaces where you can't build.-Sound is s**t and also cannot add custom music to speakers. It's a major turn-off.Cons (Due to early access)-Occlusion poorly optimized- some paths turn invisible, tracks will disappear, etc.-Optimization and Textures (can be fixed so lets give them that- probably a memory thing)-Staff buildings share same model, use different sign/flag. Couldn't mechanics have toolboxes outside? Janitors mops?-Models for coaster trains (especially in coaster-cam) are bad. I get this may be part of optimization process. Or at least I will continue to tell myself that.-Roller coaster TYCOON world. Add shops and soon you'll be rich. No work needed. Get the point?MOVING ON... there is much potential in this game but after being led along for so many months and told that this game was almost finished, it still handles, looks, and plays like an alpha. The coaster building is great but if you're like me and hardly make custom coasters, you tend to focus on other things. I'm requesting a refund, but definitely gonna come back and see the progress in a few months. Right now, there are too many core problems but most importantly, NEGATIVE FEEDBACK, that will most likely cause them to not get enough funding TO fix the game. I want to believe that these problems will be addressed and fixed in time but the writing on the wall says that they'll make one patch, release it fully, and add half♥♥♥♥♥♥♥DLC to milk as much as they can before abandoning ship. Although, to be honest, if they DO make the effort into fixing it, I can easily see this becoming something great. I'd reccomend watching as this progresses before you commit to a purchase- they will either fix it or pull out completely and there's no way of telling what they'll do at this point.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								RollerCoaster Tycoon is evolving and it has come a long way from the previous versions. It is going to take awhile to get used to everything, unlike the older versions where everything is pretty much click, drop and go. Myself, I have massive ocd and the pathing is pretty much going to bother me, because no matter what I do it just wants to curve all over the place to snap to the other path. Trial and error I guess. A lot of these negative reviews come from the beta version weekend. If you are a real fan then do not let the reviews change your mind on getting the game. Yes, the price tag is high for what it is and hopefully the outcome will be worth it in the end. There are bugs and other things that need to be fixed, but as a community we can report them to get them fixed. I, for one am happy that they opened the game as early access for us to play. I have waited years for this and now I can get my fix.I will be getting Planet Coaster as well becuase I am a Coaster building fan, but my heart will always belong with RollerCoaster Tycoon. There is no negative review that will ever change my mind or make me think differently.EDIT - By the way, everyone sounds like they are having intercourse and I can't figure out how to mute it lol. Also the UGC has never worked for me. It has been blank since day one and it doesn't seem like they are doing anything about it.

Early Access Review
								I've only spent a few hours on this but so far I've only come across one issue described as a con: deleting things is a pain. I will say that I have a powerful rig and can run the higher settings of the game. The only lag I've experienced is when a structure is selected on the build menu for the first time. number of helpful: 2 of 9 people (22%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7
												While I do recommend this game, I don't recommend paying full price. There are a lot of little issues here and there and this doesn't play much like the old Rollercoaster Tycoon games. I really enjoy this game, but even on a high performance computer, it doesn't run smoothly. There is a lot of the camera getting stuck when moving around, menus not popping up when you click on a person, ride, ect. Outside of its issues, the game is fun. Its sandbox feature is exactly what I was looking for with the ability to move the camera around to get right up on the buildings and rides. I wish the ability to play pre-made parks like the old rollercoaster tycoon games was a feature, but it doesn't seem to be. The pre-built parks you play are more of levels in a tutorial of the game. Overall, I would say this game is bugged and has a rushed feel which is why I wouldn't recommend paying $35 or more for this game, as I did. However, if you really enjoy these types of games, and are looking to build your own parks with an up-close feel, this is the game for you... as long as you can get past all those little glitchy issues!

number of helpful: 2 of 9 people (22%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've got 3.6 hours in this game and over 200+ in the other RCT games. I grew up with RCT getting my first one from a ceral box as a young child. I love RCT so That's how I'm apporaching this review. TL:DR at the bottom.The game is buggy and has loads of issues. I've had texture problems on rides, rollercoaster work during testing than later not make it back to the station for no reason, disapearing sceneary, slowness, game systems just not working at all and a plethera of many, many other issues. The game has 6 different rollercoasters, and a handful of other rides that are mostly based on themes that you might not want in a generic park. This game is no where near release ready... but it's a prime subject for Early Access.With a lot of games you know from the first few hours if a game has potential or not in Early Access, if it will ever get better or stay complete crap. I can say that RCTW is not the latter, this game has so much potential, it's just not there yet. As I stated above it has so many bugs and issues and lacks key mechanics like being able to tell janitors where they are alowed to go and where they should stay.There's so many issues like how after getting off of a ride every single person on that ride will throw up. Also guests just pee everywhere, literally every where even outside of washrooms. You don't get enough feedback as to why somethign isn't working or why guests are unhappy or why they litter right beside a garbage can. And yet, this game is just as addicting as the others. I do recomend this game but only if you go into it knowing that this is not ready, no where near ready. It fees like an alpha. If you know that, and you will not go into it expecting something like RCT3 level of completeness than I recomend this. Don't go into Early Access games expecting finished products, you than are an idiot and no sympathy is given to you.

number of helpful: 2 of 9 people (22%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								Very glad that RollerCoaster Tycoon has made a comeback after 12 years. As for everyone who are leaving negative feedback about the game, you do know it's an "Early Acess" right? It's not the final product. You people need to stop whining about how bad this game is. Yes it has performance issues, yes there's  a lot of features from previous games missing and etc, but these guys are working hard on this game. The whole point of early access is to help developers get ideas. The game is fun, and it brings back the nostalgia!While you people are bashing the game, how come you don't talk about the good? RCT comes out with constant updates that brings many features and fixes. Just recently, on April 20th, they released a major update. The graphics are cartoonish, but RollerCoaster Tycoon always looked cartoonish and not realistic.The new Coaster Builder is amazing once you get the hang of it. The game supports Steam Workshop. Sharing Coaster Blueprints was a bright Idea. You can share each other's coasters and add them to your park. You can visit other people's park! The new grid system and, of course, the a new system where you can place objects, foliage, trees, food stands and rides at any angle. The new Curve path system. It's a new addition to the RTC series. Yes, there's some bugs with it. But what do you expect on a  EARLY ACCESS game? RollerCoaster Tycoon World is amazing! It brings back the fun of RCT3. Yes many work needs to be done with the game. But I'm not upset because I know they will bring it to success. The performance, the long loading and other major bugs doesn't bother me cause THE GAME IS STILL IN DEVELOPMENT! I understand people are giving the game negative feedback, that's their opinion. But what did you really expect from an Early Access game? So yeah, if you a die-hard RCT fan as I am, I would say it's worth picking this game up. They constantly update the game.   But, if you want, you can just wait till the final product is release.

number of helpful: 1 of 7 people (14%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								I wouldn't recommend this for anyone who is expecting a perfect game. Rollercoaster Tycoon World is far from perfect, and it certainly isn't ready for anybody who isn't willing to deal with bugs. This game has them. Some are game-breaking (like, I can't launch scenarios without my game crashing entirely, in one case requiring a complete reboot of my ROG laptop) and some aren't (my favorite thus far are the horrible animations on the giant slide - I laughed at that for far too long). However, I feel the game is fun, and it has a lot of potential. Some people are also experiencing issues with RAM leaks; I am one that can say that I haven't had that issue on any of the devices that I have played RCTW on. All were laptops with good graphics cards, a quad-core proc, and 16GB of RAM. I can also say that I haven't run into anything particularly problematic yet, except the scenario-issue I mentioned earlier. And for those complaining about graphics: there's a setting that you have to disable. When we got Beta weekend 1, everyone was locked to the highest graphics possible, without any FPS prioritization. The game now adjusts automatically for the specs that it thinks the computer can handle. However, it also has an FPS prioritization setting. That  needs to be disabled to get the full quality of the game. Thankfully, my laptop (970 Geforce GTX) can handle that. Not everyone can. If you don't have the minimum specs, the game won't run well. Period. If you don't have the recommended specs, it will run better than not meeting minimum, but you still want recommended. The game is demanding, even with some optimizing. For those that don't meet recommended - wait for further optimization unless you are patient.

number of helpful: 1 of 7 people (14%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								Critical analysis of RollerCoaster Tycoon World by ChipgtIntroduction:I have always been a fan of the RollerCoaster Tycoon (RCT) Series. Like many I have been following this games progress from the beginning. However, this is my first review. I have been looking through some of the steam reviews of the game and felt that many people have been writing review very one sided reviews based on other games. What you must understand is that this review will in no way talk about another game. I feel that from a gamer's point of view you should NOT talk about how another game is better when writing about a current game. Since the early access has launched a week ago the developer has released 5 large updates in response to what their users have been saying. This is awesome, because many of the changes have been based on user feed back. So without anymore delay I will discuss what I like and would like to see changed.Delete tool:OK, Of all the things in this game the delete tool by far needs to be one of them. With the added features of bushes, flowers, trees, and more in the random terrain generator there is more that the users must delete in order to build a ride. Currently as of the 5th update you must individually delete one thing at a time. This is extremely annoying. In game time it took me a year to delete a small area to build a ride. I would like to see a delete tool that allows the user to delete more than one object at a time. Or an option were when you hold down the mouse button you can paint away (delete) just dragging over something.  Road/ PathsSo when compared to RCT3 this has come a long way in a good direction. However I have found that there are issues when trying to connect a new section to an old in the transition form large path to small. For example, If I plop a store on a long path, and then want to make an intersection in a different place I am ofter forced to connect it adjacent to a store. In other cases I found areas where I wasn't allowed to build a path and there was nothing there blocking it. Over all I like how it works I just would like to see these restrictions addressed. Other times I want to delete a small section and redo it and I can't. I would also like to have the option to change the theme of a path that is already plopped. This would be a nice tool for theme while building new or modifying old sections.Coaster builder:This has by far had the most critiques by many people and I have to say this tool actually is good. I'm not saying its the best, but it is good. I have used other coaster simulators in the past with NO limits and there are a few features that I would really like to see come to RTC world for example, multi view builder. I found that when building a coaster I am moving my view everywhere. It would be nice to have a top down separate view in a remade construction GUI would be nice. This would make building coaster easier.Building builder:I love new new buildings. However, I would really like to have tools to build my own. Something that would be scale to the new restaurants would be very nice.Conclusion:RCTW is still in early access, the game series has come a long way, and will only continue to get better as it gets closer to official release. It will take users and any gamer who is interested in this series to provide continuous input as new updates come out. I for one will continue to add to my review until official release. THanks for reading.-Chipgt

I have used other coaster simulators in the past with NO limits and there are a few features that I would really like to see come to RTC world for example, multi view builder. I found that when building a coaster I am moving my view everywhere. It would be nice to have a top down separate view in a remade construction GUI would be nice. This would make building coaster easier.Building builder:I love new new buildings. However, I would really like to have tools to build my own. Something that would be scale to the new restaurants would be very nice.Conclusion:RCTW is still in early access, the game series has come a long way, and will only continue to get better as it gets closer to official release. It will take users and any gamer who is interested in this series to provide continuous input as new updates come out. I for one will continue to add to my review until official release. THanks for reading.-Chipgt

number of helpful: 0 of 5 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								Having played this game for just over 19 hours I want to give my fair assessment of the game.  There is no denying that this game has been riddled with problems from the start.  That being said, while I was not happy to hear of the "early access label" I definitely support the decision now.  This game is not remotely near full release!There is no denying that this game has a lot of issues.  The real question is whether or not the game is moving in the right direction.  Pros:-coaster mechanics have vastly improved from the beta-looks and feels like Roller Coaster Tycoon series-a fair selection of aufio and video settings-farily strong visuals (though nowhere near close to Planet Coaster!)-a large assortment of props and settings-a fair selection of options:  campaign, sandbox, etc.-incredibly fast load times-an easy to use interface-the ability to buy more land to expand your park-easy to use teraforming options-three types of land/terrain with more coming in future updates-prompt responses from the developer and a timely update of upcoming changes and additions-steam workshop creations Cons:-the path system is very awkard at times-manually deleting of every single object (aka no mass delete)-limited amount and variety of rides, shops and food options (at this time)-no ability to build structures using idividual pieces (will be added at a later date)-peeps (they are awful re: visuals, movement, etc.)-30 second night cycle (I really don't get this one...???)  -maitenance doesn't seem to work and/or is very buggy-rides break down and often don't get fixed in a tmely manner, or at all-no ability to place lights and benches on elevated paths-complete lack of optimization... this game will make your system "work" for it!-occasional crashes and there is NO Autosave featureI have faith in this game but I also have many concerns and reservations.  I was tempted to ask for a refund but I made the choice to commit to the game simply because I want the game to be successful.  I had 100's of hours of playing RCT3 and I want this game to deliver so I have decided to support Atari on this one in the hopes that this can turn into something special.  Only time will tell if that is a sound decision.I also plan to buy Planet Coaster at some point.  However, a big issue with PC is the GPU specs.  Most systems will be able to play Roller Coaster Tycoon World.  The video card requirements for PC are very high at this time and a lot of people will not have the hardware to run the game at optimal levels, if at all.   RCTW can cater to a much larger market at this time and the fact that it's on Steam is huge for me.   For people who want the Roller Coaster Tycoon experience and are willing to put up with a lot of bugs and glitches and minimal content, then I recommend the purchase in order to help out the development team.  If you don't want to put up with all of the hassles of "early access" then I strongly reccomend that you pass on this game for now.  Be very clear that if you buy this game you will be getting a very incomplete experience.  So, do you want to support the developers or do you want to wait and see? That's my .02c  Take it for what it's worth.

Early Access Review
								RollerCoaster Tycoon World is fun and has more content then I expected for Early Access. The graphics are nice for this type of game and it runs smoothly for the most part. In my opinion they have improved in many ways from the older RollerCoaster Tycoon games, but it is missing a few things that I feel are important, such as the ability to set routes for your staff. 												With 3 theme-park games released (Rollercoaster Tycoon, Planet Coaster, and [still in early Access] Parkitect), I kinda got overwhelmed with the games I'd been waiting for a long time. So like my opinion or not: I enjoy this game. PS: Please stop the hate, say what you do not like, deliver arguments about what that game lacks, but please don't be a whiny emotional hatetroll! content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								Addictive, Fun and Early Access!In the Few hours I've played with RCTW. I've found the game to be very fun, I lost a lot of hours in my first game session.The game is still in "EA" And some people seem to be expecting magnificent results. "Is the game buggy?"- A little, If you have a underspec'd PC , Or badly setup, Expect crashes, issues and bad performance. With my setup I get on avarage 50-70fps with the only time it dropping on loading big coasters. Loading times in between screens is short and hasn't crashed yet. The game crashed once while on a twitch stream, That in mind I had Google chrome open and eating away a good 40% of my Ram. nothing ground breaking, Just a bit of optimization and small patches should get it working fine."Is the gameplay good?" - Yes! Overall it was a joyful experience, I had many tasks, And a lot went wrong, but after that it went smooth and I had felt like I had achieved something. The tutorial is fairly simple with you learning more for yourself. But for first timers it gives you plenty of info and can be skipped. I see a lot of competition between RCTW and PC. A lot of Veteran fans to the series seem upset.RCTW is a lot lot cheaper over PC. On the opening screen of RCTW, They say there will be bugs and anything you want to change/add or even remove because you think its bad. Tell them! As they are open to peoples opinions.. They heard from the community that it was unfinished and that they should push it back, they did. They also changed many other little things.I can't say this game is the best RCT, Nor can I say its a perfect game. But its fun, its cheaper than its competitors, and all round fairly cheap anyway. It has lots of fun, I've seen much buggier EA games. And for its EA as of now. you get a lot of tools and things to play around with. You'll also be able to shape the finished product if you give feedback on what you want.TL;DR:So overall " It's a not half bad Theme park Sim that is closer to its last gen game over its classic RCT 1 and 2. But still packs a great deal of fun and time to be played with all possibilities of the game changing down to you!"75/100 - I look forward to what they will add!Review will change on Release date.

content:
Posted: April 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								As a fan of Roller Coaster Tycoon through this title, I say to the negative reviews, YOU ARE WRONG!!!Before my input, I will tell you if it’s worth it. YES! YES! YES! BUY IT NOW THEN READ MY REVIEW!That being settled. The review: I waited forever for this game to release because of the negative reviews. They were going to release it many months ago and I was EXCITED! Then due to negative feedback, they decided to wait for release until they fix and add stuff to the game. THANKS A LOT NEGATIVE PEOPLE! >:( Then they released it and yeah, it has some issues, but it's still EARLY ACCESS! How about shut up already! It's not even complete and people like me paid a lot of money for the Deluxe Edition and I had to wait months to actually play it. The only way people could not like this edition is one of two ways. 1. You are a fan from the first game of the series and you expect WAY too much from this title. Not only do you expect it to be incredible graphics and mechanics because pc gaming has changed so much in the last several years since RCT 3, but you act entitled. You expect it to be some kind of magical fairyland of new gaming. It's NOT! It's a new title and it DOES keep true to the originals. It is an upgrade basically. 2. You are too young to appreciate it. You started the series way after windows 98 and XP were the it thing. You didn't see what a revolutionary game it was for its time. So you have ZERO nostalgia or background to appreciate it. It's kind of like X-COM fans who never played the original UFO Defense or Terror from the Deep. You don't get how good it was and it doesn't bring back memories of when you were a young gamer playing on that crappy computer that was barely able to word process. It was amazing and fun and you can appreciate the new ones because you understand its journey.Pros:- The game is true to the original series in many ways.- Great game mechanics - Great graphics in its current state- New more customizable elements. (Ex. Path curving, point by point roller coaster editing, etc.)Cons:- Still has some work that needs to be done. (Forgivable amount of work and expected in Early Access.)- Negative reviewers and reviewsSummary:Worthwhile game and great for true fans of the series! A worthy buy!

content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								Please don't take the 'Mostly Negative' reviews for granted!It's extremely clear after playing about 6 hours of Early Access that the game is nowhere near complete. This is in both variety of contents and overall optimisation. The fact is however, that the lack of content isn't at all a problem right now, the game, over time, will have new features and shop, rides, coasters, etc. added to it eventually so we have a lot to look forward to, also the premade coasters don't have any banked turns and there's no way to edit them in game.On the other hand, the game's optimisation is very poor, of course this can be fixed by the developers but, at the minute, is a huge problem. FPS drops early game, buggy coaster builder, poor shadow movement, etc.I, however, believe that once this game is fully developed and out of early access, the game will live up to it's initial expectations, the 'mostly negative' doesn't mean anything at the minute, if you've ever played RCT 1, 2 or 3, you'll know where I'm coming from. If you're new to RCT, only buy into the game if you know what to expect, otherwise you'll probably be disappointed until it's out of early access.

content:
Posted: November 1, 2015
												Optimization issues would be the main flaw to this game. As soon as you start adding new stuff into the park, the frame rate takes a massive hit and I'm running on a i7 6 Core CPU, 8GB DDR4 RAM and a GTX 970. Gameplay is actually not bad, it's vastly improved and makes building much faster.I really don't understand the complaints as I've had issues with the previous entry into the series about the gameplay, though a grid system wouldn't be bad to add in as an extra for people who want to build paths that are equal. That would be my main complaint about the gameplay really because I can't access the other stuff until launch. Graphics looking nice.For a RollerCoaster Tycoon game, the graphics are actually pretty good for a change but I did notices a few graphically errors like the ground changing resolution the further you move away from the ground but character models look decent and the overall RollerCoasters look great. Sound design is alright.Now, what I really have an issue is the lack of sound in this game. The RollerCoaster sound effects are awesome and all but I would really like to be able to add music onto the ride as well as hear different varites of music. The sound does cut out when you open a ride and then suddenly click the building tool which was pretty strange. Overall: People are holding on TOO MUCH to  nostalgia.As a fan of the series since RollerCoaster Tycoon 2, I've had little to no issues with the game mainly because it was a BETA GAME and not the final product. But I must say that what I've been having great fun in the game it's actually really good and has the potential to be great! Also, to the people complaining about how "It doesn't keep to the old style", grow up. This is a game that actually IMPROVES upon the sequels and gives you more creative freedom to make amazing Death-traps- I mean amazing "RollerCoasters" and gives new comers to the series an easy access to the game if they haven't played before.I'm not going to give it a rating because I want to try out the full game but from what I've seen from the beta it's a:Have a Go - Rating

content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								After the long wait I am pleased to say that this game is well on it's way to greatness. Some features need to be fixed up a bit, such as clearing items in multiple instead of one at a time, however overall I had a great time playing the campaign to get my bearings. As it is, I would say it is complete enough for the game to be enjoyable, any further fixes are just polishing it up more.The graphics are also really smooth, I played on high setting with no lag. Cant wait to see how it looks when it is complete! :)Update:People need to calm down. The reviews are mostly negative because clearly people expected a finished game. I did too, however I know that this game is well from finished and the team updates and fixes things according to user data quite regularily. It is coming along and it has already improved immensly from release. I very much enjoy this game, I mostly have been playing in sandbox mode for some casual fun, and I cant wait for the next updates!Update 2:I am very impressed with the efforts of the team managing this game! It gets updated frequently, DLCs are fantastic, they are paying attention to bugs and fixing them. I truly believe that this game will only continue to improve.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								Awesome start, but the early access version certainly leaves a lot for improvement. I expect fans of the franchise will love it, and newbies won't. I'm a fan, so I LOVE it. But as of March 30th (early access launch date) many of the things I love most are missing from the game. Some of the things I expect to be improved are as follows:1. Being able to change the color of the rides. 2. More control (or at least better effectiveness) of staff (especially janitors), 3. Easier path-making (especially curves) - to this end, it would be nice to have some pre-built curves like a quarter circle which could be resized. Doing it manually is tedious and frustrating.4. Simple color-block decor pieces- One of the beautiful things about RCT2 was the ability to stack and arrange decorative elements to create cool structures. This should be even BETTER in RCTW, but it sounds like they just want users to make the stuff for them. A minecraft-style building-block option would be a blast and it should be easy to do.I LOVE the interface. It is way ahead of RCT3 in pretty much every way! A few months from now I'm expecting to love this game. Right now, it's just "all-right".

content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								I bought this game in march so I didn't get a chance to see the older beta access. But, I get to see early access which is great! Sometimes it says that the game is not responding and I have to close it but I think that it is because I have 8GB of ram and the requirement is 6GB. I like the spline based coaster builder. It is very fun to make round coasters as it curves just how you want it. I saw that some peeps (Mechanic, and others) look like they don't have a moving animation, they just move with their body frozen. It looks like they have rollerskates. Seriously it's true! I recommend this game if you don't mind bugs and any other things. I don't like how you can't select multiple things to delete. That option was good in RCT3 so I think it should come back. At first I wasn't very good at the camera control but later I got really used to it. I think that there should be autosave (backup save) so that if your game crashes, your info is still there.Pros:Simple coaster builder.Wide range of graphics options.Very realistic peeps in terms of stats.Great campaign mode (gives you help.)Cons:Glitchy peeps.Coasters need lots of adjusting before they work.Lags when there are over 1000 peepsNo autosave.I would have to go into the game to look for more things.Thanks!

content:
Posted: May 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								Built a circus, featuring a woman flying right across the screen.I was really unsure if I wanted to buy the game or not considering the high price (for an unfinished game) and all the negative reviews. My boredom and love for the RCT series got me to buy it anyway, and I honestly can't understand what all the complaints are about. The game works just fine for me, it's a bit slow when starting up a saved campaign, but nothing too troublesome. It was a bit confusing in the beginning, but it's a brand new game to learn as well, and it didn't take too long to understand how to build stuff. So far the only trouble I had with building is the roads, but use lots of space for now and you should be okay . The coaster builder is also a lot of fun, I enjoy building my own coaster a lot more now than I did in the older games. The guests have bugged out and stood still for a short while, but they started acting normal again soon. This has happened only once so far (after 5 hours) and wasn't really a huge problem for me because I could still build attractions and do whatever I wanted.One thing I miss from the older games is actually being able to throw around the janitors to sweep the paths, my paths are disgusting right now even with all the janitors patrolling. Right now you can't really control the park staff at all (unless I've missed something.) I'm assuming this will be added soon, along with bugfixes and more awesome features. It's still in early access so there's some things missing, but if you're a die-hard RCT fan I would reccommend testing it out. I'm not tired after 5 hours, there's still a lot for me to build, and so far I've only played the campaign mode. If you're an old fan or new to these games and not sure about buying it, maybe wait until release.I like this game as is much better than RCT3, so I'm sure it will be great when it's done.

content:
Posted: November 1, 2015
												This review here currently is based completely on Beta 1, I have a video too if you wish to see more in-depth and footage to back it up. So basic rides and normal buildings are turned off for this, paths, decorations and the main meat of the game, coasters are there. Now I have to say the coaster editor is HUGE, you can change the track styles, the type of rollercoaster, the pitch, turn, edge and speed of your tracks. Have a massive drop and then make sure you can fix it at the end or bye bye humans. Its fantastic the amount of sheer detail to a tiny little detail can do. Paint it whatever colour you want, have multiple carts and more! I had a blast and its great to see RollerCoaster Tycoon return and with a bigger editor than ever! content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								The Game is progressing extremely well I think the main issues before the game crashed was the coaster building was lagging after it reached a proximity of $10,000 to build ( Game Crashed at $13,000). The Paths im having issues with the shops. I had to to a zig zag when placing paths to individual shops which I thought was a little scrazy. The Peeps/Ride Cam wasnt working on my computer and neither were the buttons as they hovered over the main options bar (Paths, Scenary, Buildings, Rides etc). The Tool to remove objects with was always picking up where my mouse was so i had to be away but near the object to delete. The People in the game are coming along really nice but some work is needed. As an understanding to the early access it is quite buggy as you mention so the best thing I did was not to rush and wait 2-3 secs after placing each object. Coaster Building I'm Still  Struggling with to control. Everytime I wanna go down it goes up and the nodes are extremely sensitve. When Clicking on a piece of the track it should not move unless wanting too (Sensitve) asin my case i tried twisting some turns and lowering/rasing track pieces and all it kept doing was moving around so maybe a feature to lock the track in place to stopit from moving or reduce sensitivity. Out of 2 hours of playing I could on place 5 buildings (3 Food Stalls, Information and Restrooms), 3 Rides one from each category (Didnt see or get any bugs while they were running) and few scenary objects from the mission. My Laptop crashed when I finished it and wanted to test run it. The game is actually pretty good but while running Nvidia 740M or Intel 4600 graphics cards it still bugy... Just wandering if you maybe have the graphics/resolution of the game to high still? I know its been reduced from last years trial in October but its probably only going to work %100 on desktops that have 4Gbs or more graphics/video cards and higher screen resoultions which is a bad thing for many of us tycoons out there. At this current stage I will give the game an 7.5/10 for qaulity and performance.~UPDATE~ 1/4/16Okay So after playing it for a whie now and still having issues with bugs. As mentioned in earlier reviews the paths need fixing, i dont know how to widen the paths, the rides break down after a year and the bins do nothing. Made a Wooden Coaster (I dont Recommend) it has to continually buffer and reboot the whole tracks supports just to change and just recently I built this awesome Floorless coaster which Just Crashed my Computer while running on 1020ppi. The game uses exactly 4gbs of ram which has got me questioning why as we only downloaded 1.2gb of gaming data. Its slow to import tracks, The paths are never straight (zig zag) and watching peeps getting into the coaster is hilarious but obvisiously its not meant to happen like that as some may all ready know you can watch the peeps get in and out but its like a claw just picked them up and plopped them in (falling from the beems/light height. Expansion is easy to do if you follow the tutorial its really basic except when building a coaster. What everyone needs to know its a work in progress Planet Coaster is going to have the exact same building style as tycoon however there graphics is smoother whereas in my experience in 1020ppi is harsh and rough in some areas. When moving around the map get difficult as clicking the arrows direction once u end up on the other side of the map/park and you can only do so much detail in your park with decorations and shops before you start to lag and loose controls.MAJOR HEADS UP!If your coaster is costing any over $10,000 you will experience minor issues. Now if your coaster is over 15,000 to 25,000 cash then you are gaurantee your computer to fry like a french fry. I made it to 19-20,000 and BSOD I got. The expansion are easy but are hard to gain as they double each time starting from 8,000 for your first lot. I still love the game and when the bugs and issues get fixed I cant wait to play an non issuing game. It's a work in progress Ill ive the game 6 Months as of today to get 90% minimum of functionality till I stop playing it. I still Couldnt use the peeps cam properly on rides but ont he coaster I have to use my key arrows not the on screen. The Pathing needs more freedom and more colors should be added to the coaster even a color wheel/panel ranging from 365 Color ratio. Also the best way for the park to run smoothly is to disable your internet once loaded the menu screen close everything except steam (Disable/Turn off Security Firewall Temporarily) and the game should give you a good 3-4 hours happiness playing. I did notice that some of the rides where too big for the park and we should have a freedom rand of where we put the Entry's/Exits to boost creativity. The Brakes and Boost force I still dont understand like what does the ratio even mean I tried having a Slow friction brake before a drop and my coaster stalled on a 1.0 ration when flying through at 60-80kmh. Ctrl Z should be an undo button for any building criteria. I accidnetally deleted a section of a track and I couldnt recover it so I tried fixing but the corners or straights were off point and increased nausea manged to get 35 in Nausea for my Floorless some how when it was smooth and delicate besides near the chain lift and brakes near station. YOU TRY AND MAKE A GAME LIKE THIS WORK 100% BEFORE ACTUAL RELEASE. number of helpful: 0 of 7 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								Look, don't necessarily believe all the negative reviews on this Early Access. Is this going to be a good game? Yes, absolutely. Is it ready to go right now? No. That's why it's early access.I grew up playing the original RC Tycoon games, and this is definitely going to be a worthy spiritual successor. The graphics are good for a simulation game, similar to Cities: Skylines, but not similar to GTA V, or Crysis 3 (it's about perspective here, it doesn't 'need' photo realism). RCT World needs some optimization work on the park guest animations, and so far, you can only build Junior, Family, and basic Thrill rides.  I'd definitely recommend waiting if you're looking for a finished product, but if you are wanting to see the development from now til release check this out.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								I'm getting a little bit fed up with seeing negative reviews from people who are either basing their views on the Beta, or are just saying "Get Planet Coaster". The game isn't perfect, heck it's not even finished (hence early access), but I've been hooked since it launched into Early Access. From the beta, Nvizzio and Atari have definitely improved features and I can confidently say that this is an addictive Rollercoaster Tycoon game, albeit glitchy, rough around the edges, and needing a few improvements. I truly believe this will be a great game once it's ready for "final release".The positives:- A great addition to the RollerCoaster Tycoon franchise, considering the fact that it's been passed to many different developres throughout it's development cycle.- Early Access. Atari/Nvizzio can see what we like, dislike, and improve it before final release.- Coaster builder is great fun, many improvements have been made since the beta.- The themes provided in-game are nice; I've enjoyed creating different "zones" in my park. Currently working on a Wild Western area as I type this.- Ride the rides, returning from RCT3.- Large variety of decorative pieces for the park, and 3 different maps.The negatives for me consist of:- Having to manually bulldoze trees/foliage to place buildings which is tempermental. Would prefer it if they were automatically removed.- Path tool can be very annoying at times.- Performance is rough - sometimes very smooth, othertimes the game will get sluggish.- Graphics are generally fine, although shadows seem to disappear at times which makes the game look poor. - Peeps will sometimes not animate and just slide about the park.To summarise... the game isn't finished. Remember that. RCTW has many positives, and definitely needs some work, but that doesn't stop it being a fun game. I would say to give it a try if you've enjoyed previous instalments but if you're unsure, then wait for the final release to make your decision as this is in early access.RCTW and PC will be great additions to the tycoon/simulation genre, and them both releasing at the same time is a good thing as it means they can both learn from each other and their communities.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2016
												The game really isn't as bad as everyone says.  I kind of enjoy it.  The coaster builder is great, but even better is the goaster editing tool, once the coaster has already been completed.  The game is simple and enjoyable.  While I don't mind the system for unlocking rides, I would have prefered using the old "research" method used by previous games.Really, the only problem I have with this game is that it crashes quite frequently.  I've played the game for 5 hours and it has crashed about 5 times.  I don't love that.  but when the game plays, I have fun with it.  It is not planet coaster, but it wasn't trying to be.  I picked this game up on sale, and I would recommend it for the price I paid.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								I think the coaster editor has been greatly improved.  I'm already loving being able to easily download items from the Steam workshop.  This game runs great on my computer & doesn't take as much CPU as Planet Coaster.  So that means I can still stream it too!  Thanks for getting this game out to us sooner!  I think the user feedback will help Nvizzio decide what to tackle next (Seems like the 1st thing would be peeps).  But look at the feedback that was provided during the October Beta, and now the Coaster editor is 100 times better!  I've always been looking for that perfect combination of No Limits spline based bezier curves & ease of build such as RCT3.  I feel like I finally have that now with this game.  Even if the rest of the game remains broken (which it won't) I don't care :-P
